Article_Title: Anti-Vax Couple Dine-In As ‘Social Experiment’, Then Brag About It On Facebook
Content: New SOPs had relaxed the rules for people who’ve completed their Covid-19 vaccinations.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.Malaysians are collectively condemning an unsolicited ‘social experiment’ allegedly done by a couple of local anti-vaxxers who refused to follow Covid-19 health guidelines, endangering the lives of those around them.Netizens were disturbed by a Facebook posting allegedly made by a user named Mujaheeda Soleha who wrote about her recent experience of going around in public without having herself or her husband fully vaccinated for coronavirus.The curious FB confession details a so-called social experiment she and her husband conducted – where they went around to see if they can get away with not having a valid ‘vaccine passport’.The last couple of days I’ve been doing a social experiment after it became news that you’d need to complete two vaccine doses to be allowed in anywhere. People who were unhappy with anti-vaxxers say that without two doses, you’d just have to waste away at home. Well, just testing things out for fun. I didn’t go to roadside stalls but SevenEleven, 99 Speedmart and Pizza Hut. I went to every store and not a single premise checked to see if I’ve received two vaccination doses.The posting also tells of how her husband was refused service at one barbershop, however, managed to get his haircut at another store instead, who apparently weren’t too particular with SOPs.My husband also did his own social experiment where he went to the barber to get a haircut but was kicked out. Both the barbers worked together to throw him out because he didn’t have two vaccine shots. My poor husband. Finally he went to this one barber shop that didn’t ask for anything.Mujaheeda also told of how her family had a nice dine-in meal at a restaurant that was crowded with people after they went on a family bicycle ride.“We saw that there were many people dining in there. So we simply went in with confident faces like we’ve had three vaccination doses. Sat down, ate and left. Not a single person asked or checked.” note the posting together with several snapshots of the couple who were seen dining together at a mamak restaurant with two children.Who said you needed two vaccine dose to dine in? Even without two vaccine doses, we safetly dined in this morning. Nothing is impossible.Concerningly, comments left on Mujaheeda’s posting also note that there were other anti-vaxxers who are regularly travelling across state borders without being vaccinated.TRP’s own check revealed that the Facebook account and posting in question was no longer available for public view. However social media detectives were not only able to take screenshots of the posting but also apparently managed to track down that the family was living in Klang, Selangor and asked that the authorities act immediately.Hallo Polis @PolisDirajaMsia @KKMPutrajaya , bebal detected. Please do something before it spread even further 💆🏻‍♀️💆🏻‍♀️💆🏻‍♀️ https://t.co/amGVPLkE5dThe issue had triggered many to call out the couple’s irresponsible behaviour for not only putting themselves and their children at risk but for totally undermining the nation’s efforts at putting an end to the Covid-19 crisis.A social experiment without being socially responsible. https://t.co/oDWYx41eL7Looking at her kids, i feel sad for them. For having stupid, ignorant parents. Parents who willing to endanger their kids’ lives all for social experiments, egotistical & ignorance. https://t.co/NxpLeRntfxOn August 20, new SOPs under the National Covid-19 Recovery Plan (PPN) kicked in which relaxed some of the restrictions we’ve been living with under the MCO.Among these included allowing people who’ve completed two full doses of the Covid-19 inoculations to be able to dine-in at restaurants and perform a number of other limited activities while still obeying new normal guidelines.Read More: Official MKN SOP For Phase 1 Of PPN As Of 20 August (In English)This issue however raises the question of how the government and authorities would be enforcing the rules and maintaining the health and safety of the public.Read More: There Is An App To Verify The New Covid-19 Vaccination Digital Certificate. Here’s How To Use ItThere were also concerns floating around that there were now ways for people to falsify documentation and that some are using fake vaccine passports to mislead others.Former Deputy Health Minister Datuk Dr Noor Azmi Ghazali previously warned authorities to be vigilant of such attempts and said that the government (at the time) was looking to remedy the problem.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: The Use Of GPs In Vaccinations Not Cancelled, Just Being Reevaluated
Content: GPs might play a role once we determine whether we need booster shots and vaccinate those under the age of 17 years.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The Covid-19 Immunisation Task Force (CITF) issued a statement today addressing reports that the use of private health practitioners (GP) in the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (PICK) has been cancelled.According to CITF, the efforts to increase the capacity of PICK operations in the Klang Valley that started on 26 July, was effective. So much so that there is now a need to reduce the number of Vaccination Centers (PPV) in the area.As of 22 August, 12 PPVs have been decommissioned. Between 23 and 29 August, 21 more PPVs will be closed in the Klang Valley. Out of these 32 PPVs, seven are GPs.That said, the CITF did not rule out the possibility that these PPVs would be recommissioned once the decision about booster shots and vaccinating children between 12 and 17 years old have been made.The CITF also said that they would make announcements regarding the matter from time to time and asked all parties to cease speculations.Dakwaan yang menyatakan bahawa penglibatan GP akan dihentikan adalah tidak tepat. Penglibatan GP di masa hadapan akan dipertimbangkan dalam menjamin kesinambungan kepada program imunisasi COVID-19 kerana tiada lagi PPV akan beroperasi ketika itu. https://t.co/exOGtgk7tG pic.twitter.com/1skSWZv69sShare your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: [UPDATE] 779 Teachers In Johor Said No To The Covid-19 Vaccine. Now TMJ Wants To Meet Them.
Content:
Good news is that over 96.26% of teachers in Johor have been vaccinated.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Since the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme started, 45,448 teachers in Johor fulfilled their responsibility and have received at least the first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. A little more than half of them or 50.29% are fully vaccinated reported Utusan. However, based on the same statistics, 779 teachers refused to be vaccinated, 12 have not yet registered, and two have yet to update their data. Johor Education, Information, Heritage and Culture Committee chairman Mazlan Bujang,  reported Harian Metro, said that the Johor Education Department will help to explain to each teacher who refused the vaccination, individually, the importance of the vaccination especially then schools are expected to open in October. At the same time, we have to understand that there are a few valid health reasons why someone could not take the Covid-19 vaccine. Also do not discount the fact that there is a chance some of these teachers accidentally tapped no.[UPDATE Tunku Mahkota Johor, Tunku Ismail Sultan Ibrahim announced in a tweet that he wishes to meet the Johor Education Department Director and the 779 teachers to address the issue.]



Saya akan berjumpa dengan Pengarah Pendidikan Negeri Johor dan guru guru tersebut dalam masa terdekat. Keutamaan kami adalah untuk mengatasi pandemik ini secepat mungkin supaya rakyat, negeri boleh kembali dan meneruskan kehidupan seperti biasa. https://t.co/gOe15L6RKQ— HRH Crown Prince of Johor (@HRHJohorII) August 22, 2021

Article_Title: New Regulations For Walk-In Covid-19 Vaccination In Klang Valley Announced
Content: Walk-in facilities limited to 13 PPVs as numbers of walk-ins drop.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.People in the Klang Valley have been the envy of the rest of Malaysia when walk-in vaccinations were made available for those who live in the area on 2 August. However, according to the COVID-19 Immunisation Task Force (CITF), 10 days later, the number of walk-ins had dropped so significantly that they had to change some regulations to fit current needs. All Malaysian citizens in the Klang Valley may still walk-in to a PPV to get their vaccination, however, their options are now limited to 13 PPVs.They are:Starting 23 AugustStarting 25 AugustStarting 26 AugustThose who missed their vaccination’s second dose may go to any of the nearest PPV listed. If the PPV does not have the same vaccine as their first dose, they will be referred to another PPV. Walk-in is based on a first-come-first-serve basis. Individuals may be asked to return the next day if the vaccination supply for the day is fully used.Walk-in vaccination at PPV Stadium National Bukit Jalil for non-Malaysian citizens will be replaced with an appointment based method. Those who have not yet registered with the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (PICK) may do so via the MySejahtera app or call 1800-888-828 or go to www.vaksincovid.gov.my.MAKLUMAN: Vaksinasi walk-in selepas 22 Ogos di Lembah Klang. pic.twitter.com/XdUDIP4tz2Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: RELA Officer Seen “Physically Assaulting” A Migrant Worker Walking In Line To Get Vaccinated
Content: There were allegedly 3 other officers on duty and no one said anything.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The mistreatment of migrant workers in Malaysia is not a secret here in Malaysia. TRP alone has covered several stories about the struggle they’ve had to face since the start of the pandemic:We’ve even been downgraded to the lowest rank at Tier 3 in the US State Department’s annual human trafficking report due to the exploitation of migrant workers in plantations and factories.Read More: Malaysia Joins Afghanistan And North Korea In The Lowest Rank Of Tier 3 In The Annual Human Trafficking ReportAnother such example has surfaced in a Twitter post by user Sasi Rekha Ravi (@sassyRekha)It is so sad that foreigners at treated SO BADLY at #PPV #PPVbukitjalil #vaksincovid @JKJAVMY @501Awani @staronline @bharianmy @NST_Online @DGHisham pic.twitter.com/9St1ZSXHDHThe 5-second clip posted yesterday (20 August) shows what appears to be a line of foreign workers queuing to get vaccinated at the PPV Stadium Bukit Jalil.In view is a RELA officer facilitating the flow but 2 seconds in, the officer literally takes matters into his own hands by physically pushing a man back when he wasn’t paying attention.In a separate tweet, Rekha shares a letter she’s written that further explains the video in which she describes the RELA officer “literally kicking and punching several foreigners and treating them like dogs.”Although she did not record evidence of all the other incidences, she did manage to capture the one she tweeted, which has now 607.6k views.pic.twitter.com/C9qE1eqz2VRekha later claims there were at least three police officers there but none of them said anything. An excerpt of her heartfelt post says:These are foreigners who WANT to get vaccinated and are willing to wait for hours under the scorching hot such just to receive their vaccination doses. The only walk-in PPV allocated for foreigners is PPV Stadium Bukit Jalil and due to this, the queue extends to several kilometres. The least they can do is TREAT THEM LIKE HUMAN.Although RELA officers are there to ensure SOPs are followed and traffic runs smoothly, Rekha alleges the man seen in the video was shoved and almost kicked/tripped, and then posed the question of whether we would do this to a fellow Malaysia or “orang putih” (Caucasian foreigner).Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Dine-In Dibenarkan, Tapi Ada Kedai Makan Yang Masih Belum Setuju Untuk Dibuka
Content:
Aktiviti dine-in kini dibenarkan hanya untuk mereka yang telah lengkap 2 dos suntikan vaksin.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Umum sedia maklum, Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md Yasin telah mengeluarkan satu kenyataan mengenai kemudahan tambahan sektor sosial dan ekonomi bagi individu yang telah menerima vaksinasi lengkap.BACA SINI: [Terkini] Dine-In & Kemudahan Tambahan Lain Dibenarkan Bagi Negeri Di Fasa 1 PPN & SeterusnyaWalaupun ianya memberi peluang kepada restoran untuk menjana pendapatan akibat kerugian yang terpaksa dihadapi selama penutupan sektor ekonomi di bawah PKP 3.0 bermula hari ini, namun kami mendapati terdapat beberapa kedai makan dan restoran yang masih tidak dibuka untuk tujuan dine-in.BACA JUGA: Banyak Sektor Dibuka Kerana Ekonomi, Bukan Kerana Ianya Selamat – Dr Noor HishammyBurgerLabSecara ringkasnya, salah satu sebab utama di sebalik keputusan mBL adalah kerana SOP yang tidak jelas dan keselamatan kakitangan serta pelanggan.HayasushiLa Risata Bar Pizzeria RistoranteCake Jalan TiungA post shared by Cake Jalan Tiung (@cakejalantiung)Rata SubangRata Subang yang sebelum ini telah dikenakan kompaun RM10,000 pada bulan Jun lalu kerana melanggar SOP secara tidak sengaja telah memutuskan pihak mereka tidak akan membenarkan dine-in sehingga 1 September apabila semua staf telah lengkap dos vaksinasi Covid-19.A post shared by RATA (@rata_subang)McDonalds *kecuali di negeri Perlis, Sabah, Sarawak, dan Labuan.Walaupun keputusan ini mungkin akan memaksa anda untuk batalkan kesemua rancangan hujung minggu anda, namun ramai juga warganet yang bersetuju dan menyokong keputusan ini.Mana tidaknya, virus masih wujud dan kes positif harian pula masih tinggi.Muncul pula varian-varian merbahaya.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Currently leading Bahasa desk for The Rakyat Post as the Head Writer.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Banyak Sektor Dibuka Kerana Ekonomi, Bukan Kerana Ianya Selamat – Dr Noor Hisham
Content:
Tinjauan di media sosial dilihat ramai yang menerima baik kenyataan yang dikeluarkan oleh Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham ini.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Bermula hari ini (20 Ogos), Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md Yasin telah mengeluarkan satu kenyataan mengenai kemudahan tambahan sektor sosial dan ekonomi bagi individu yang telah menerima vaksinasi lengkap.Antaranya:BACA SINI: [Terkini] Dine-In & Kemudahan Tambahan Lain Dibenarkan Bagi Negeri Di Fasa 1 PPN & SeterusnyaHappy atau tidak? DEPENDS.Ada yang menarik nafas lega sebab akhirnya boleh makan di luar dan ambil udara segar. Ada juga yang memberikan pendapat sebaliknya.Benar, bahaya masih wujud selagi virus ini tidak pupus. Yang penting, ikuti SOP yang telah ditetapkan dan sentiasa berwaspada. Mana tidaknya, kita tak boleh nampak virus ini, tapi ianya sangat mudah untuk dijangkiti.Susulan pembukaan lebih banyak sektor ekonomi seperti yang diumumkan semalam, perkara tersebut turut membimbangkan pihak Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM).Oleh yang demikian, Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah melalui satu tweet telah mengingatkan rakyat Malaysia untuk sentiasa mematuhi prosedur operasi standard (SOP) yang ditetapkan.Peringatan untuk semua, banyak tempat dibuka kerana ekonomi dan bukan kerana ia selamat. Perlu diingat, sila pakai pelitup muka, pelitup muka dua lapis jika boleh, amalkan jarak fizikal dan kerap mencuci tangan. Elakkan ruang yang sesak dan terkurung. Kekal selamat dan dapatkan vaksin secepat mungkin.A reminder to all, many places are opening because of economy & not because it is safe. Please keep that in mind; please wear a mask, double masks if possible, practice physical distancing & frequent hand washing. Avoid crowded & confined spaces. Stay safe & get vaccinated asap.Kenyataan ini juga turut dipersoalkan oleh warganet yang masih keliru dan meminta pencerahan tentang peratusan ‘selamat’ yang dimaksudkan oleh KKM.DG, raayat are confused. At 73.8%, you are saying it is NOT SAFE and it is a binary btw health & economy.Tell us now:1. What % baru selamat? 100% then baru u nak declare safe?2. Is the vaccine really working or it’s just an agenda to enrich Big Pharma. pic.twitter.com/FWyhWRnXyaDr Noor Hisham seterusnya membalas soalan tersebut dengan menjelaskan POV Kementerian Kesihatan mengenai isu ini.Kita perlu menggunakan dua pendekatan; satu adalah vaksinasi dan yang lain adalah terus mengambil semua langkah pencegahan kesihatan. Israel pada awalnya telah berjaya mencapai imuniti kelompok dan kemudiannya mengurangkan sekatan dan SOP. Hari ini kes mereka melambung kembali.Apa jua yang diputuskan oleh pihak berkuasa, orang ramai perlu terus jaga SOP dan disarankan untuk kekal duduk di rumah jika tiada keperluan untuk keluar.Kalau nak makan di luar sekali-sekala apa salahnya, cuma pastikan restoran atau kedai yang dipilih tidak terlalu ramai dan mempunyai cukup ruang udara.Stay safe, guys.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Currently leading Bahasa desk for The Rakyat Post as the Head Writer.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: [Terkini] Dine-In & Kemudahan Tambahan Lain Dibenarkan Bagi Negeri Di Fasa 1 PPN & Seterusnya
Content:
Kesemua kemudahan yang diumumkan hari ini akan mula berkuatkuasa pada Jumaat, 20 Ogos 2021. Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md Yasin baru-baru ini telah mengeluarkan satu kenyataan mengenai kemudahan tambahan sektor sosial dan ekonomi bagi individu yang telah menerima vaksinasi lengkap.Namun, penting untuk dijelaskan bahawa seseorang individu hanya akan diiktiraf sebagai individu yang telah lengkap vaksinasinya apabila telah memenuhi kriteria-kriteria berikut:Menurut Mahiaddin, beliau hari ini telah mempengerusikan Sidang Khas Majlis Keselamatan Negara (MKN) bagi membincang dan mempertimbangkan cadangan oleh Jawatankuasa Khas Teknikal MKN untuk memperluaskan lagi kemudahan sektor sosial dan ekonomi terutamanya bagi Fasa 1 Pelan Pemulihan Negara (PPN).Sidang Khas MKN pada hari ini juga dihadiri oleh Ketua Pengarah Perkhidmatan Awam, Ketua-Ketua Setiausaha dari setiap Kementerian, Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan, Ketua Pengarah MKN, Ketua Pengarah Imigresen dan pegawai-pegawai kanan Kerajaan yang berkenaan.Jelas beliau lagi, pertimbangan yang dibuat pada hari ini mengambil kira perkembangan positif kadar vaksinasi lengkap populasi dewasa di seluruh negara yang telah melebihi 50%. Pencapaian ini adalah lebih awal daripada yang disasarkan sebelum ini iaitu 31 Ogos 2021.Selain itu, mesyuarat turut mengambil maklum perkembangan awal yang positif daripada Program Imunisasi Covid-19 Kebangsaan (PICK) di beberapa buah negeri iaitu di WP Labuan, Sarawak, Negeri Sembilan dan negeri-negeri Lembah Klang (Selangor, WP Kuala Lumpur dan Putrajaya).Data yang dikumpul oleh Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) menunjukkan bahawa setakat ini, kesemua negeri yang dinyatakan telah mula menunjukkan penurunan bilangan kes bagi kategori 3 hingga 5 apabila liputan dos lengkap vaksin Covid-19 bagi populasi dewasa (18 tahun dan ke atas) telah melebihi 40%.Pada masa yang sama, data daripada Crisis Preparedness Response Centre (CPRC) bagi Hospital menunjukkan situasi di Jabatan Kecemasan di Lembah Klang juga bertambah baik. Contohnya purata pesakit yang menunggu di Jabatan Kecemasan untuk ditempatkan ke wad pesakit bagi hospital KKM di negeri-negeri Lembah Klang telah menurun. Situasi ini dilihat selari dengan pencapaian kadar vaksinasi lengkap populasi dewasa di Lembah Klang yang memberangsangkan iaitu 73.8%.Apabila liputan imunisasi meningkat, kita akan melihat kes-kes Covid-19 yang perlu dimasukan ke ICU mula menunjukkan trend mendatar and diharapkan akan menurun.Kesemua kemudahan yang diumumkan hari ini akan mula berkuatkuasa pada Jumaat, 20 Ogos 2021. Perincian bagi kemudahan-kemudahan yang diumumkan ini akan dikeluarkan oleh Majlis Keselamatan Negara (MKN) dalam waktu yang terdekat.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Hampir 8,000 Frontliners Di Hospital Dijangkiti Covid-19
Content:
Daripada jumlah itu hanya 17 kes (0.22%) sahaja berada di kategori 3,4 dan 5.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Setakat 13 Ogos 2021, Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) telah merekodkan seramai 7,599 atau 3.05% petugas kesihatan telah dijangkiti Covid-19 hasil saringan berkala.Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah berkata daripada jumlah itu hanya 17 kes (0.22%) sahaja berada di kategori 3,4 dan 5. Dimaklumkan juga 2 kes kematian di kategori 5.Menurut laporan, berdasarkan kepada graf disertakan dalam hantaran itu, seramai 5,135 (67.6%) daripada 7,599 petugas kesihatan yang sudah melengkapkan vaksinasi yang dijangkiti berada dalam kategori 2 iaitu mengalami gejala ringan.Pada masa sama, sebanyak 32.2% daripada petugas kesihatan yang dijangkiti itu berada dalam kategori 1 membabitkan seramai 2,447 orang.Manakala kategori 3 (mengalami radang paru-paru), kategori 4 (memerlukan bantuan oksigen) dan kategori 5 yang dirawat di Unit Rawatan Rapi (ICU) masing-masing mencatatkan seramai 10, 4 dan 3 kes.BACA JUGA: New Norm: Kes Kian Tinggi, Ini 3 Kaedah Baca Jumlah Kes Harian Positif Covid-19Dr Noor Hisham turut menjelaskan bahawa pemberian vaksin berfungsi mengurangkan keparahan dan kematian akibat jangkitan kerana tiada vaksin yang berkesan 100%.Ianya (vaksin) bukan sifarkan keparahan dan kematian.Hari ini (17 Ogos), jumlah kes Covid-19 yang dilaporkan adalah 19,631 kes (1,444,270 kes).Berikut merupakan pecahan setiap negeri (Kumulatif):Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: ICU Mula Lengang, Tapi Kes Kematian Di Rumah (BID) Masih Tinggi & Serius
Content:
Semalam (16 Ogos), 274 kes kematian dilaporkan dan 77 daripadanya adalah Brought-In-Dead (BID).Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!“Mula nampak titik cahaya di hujung terowong yang gelap.”Antara perkara yang diungkapkan oleh pihak hospital sebuah hospital yang menjelaskan perasaan gembira yang disimpan sejak minggu lalu kerana menurutnya, kemasukan pesakit warganegara kian berkurang.Kami di Lembah Klang sudah mulai nampak titik cahaya di hujung terowong yang gelap. Samar-samar tapi penuh harapan. Awal Julai kami dapati kemasukan pesakit Covid-19 warganegara mulai menurun dan majoriti yang datang adalah warga asing.Menurutnya, rujukan pesakit daripada bahagian kecemesan kepada pasukan unit rawatan rapi (ICU) untuk pesakit kritikal juga semakin berkurangan.Jika dahulu, panjang senarai menunggu di papan tulis ICU, dengan kertas bersambung-sambung sebab tak cukup ruang. Sekarang dah nampak sedikit ruang.Menurut laporan yang dikeluarkan oleh Sinar Harian, situasi sama juga dapat dilihat bagi kes kategori lima. Ini adalah hasil keberkesanan program vaksinasi yang giat dipertingkatkan dari masa ke masa.Alhamdulillah.Pada hujung Mei lalu, Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) mendedahkan bahawa jumlah pesakit Covid-19 yang dibawa mati (BID) atau meninggal dunia akibat Covid-19 tanpa mendapat rawatan semakin meningkat dan menyenaraikan tiga ‘senario’ yang mungkin terjadi kerana trend ini dilihat berterusan.BACA SINI: Kes Brought In Dead (BID) Kian Meningkat – Ini 3 Cara Perkara Ini Boleh TerjadiKes kematian di rumah atau di luar hospital melibatkan individu yang dijangkiti virus ini pula masih tinggi dan ia perlu diberi perhatian serius.Ini kerana pesakit kategori ini mungkin tidak bergejala teruk dan kuarantin di rumah sama ada tinggal bersama keluarga atau bersendirian. Apabila diri sendiri yang memantau maka tidaklah sebaik pemantauan doktor di hospital.Amat membimbangkan.Semalam (16 Ogos), Malaysia telah mencatatkan 19,740 kes positif harian baharu. Manakala, 274 kes kematian dilaporkan dan 77 daripadanya adalah Brought-In-Dead (BID).Kami berharap pihak KKM dapat memberikan perhatian yang serius untuk menangani isu ini supaya lebih banyak nyawa dapat diselamatkan.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: [Terkini] Mahiaddin Umum Letak Jawatan Sebagai Perdana Menteri
Content:
Mahiaddin turut menzahirkan ribuan terima kasih kepada frontliners yang bekerja siang dan malam dalam menghadapi pandemik Covid-19 ini.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Perdana Menteri Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md Yasin telah mengakui bahawa beliau telah kehilangan majoriti di Parlimen dan mengundurkan diri dari jawatannya bersama dengan Kabinetnya.Dalam pengumuman hari ini, beliau mengatakan bahawa perkara seperti ini belum pernah terjadi sebelum ini dan mengatakan bahawa beliau juga menghadapi ancaman namun beliau tetap tegas untuk tidak tunduk pada kehendak lawan politik.Dalam ucapan itu, beliau juga mengatakan bahawa 87 juta dos vaksin telah dibeli untuk rakyat Malaysia dan ianya adalah lebih daripada cukup untuk melindungi rakyat menjelang bulan Oktober.Untuk vaksin pula, tidak perlu risau kerana Kabinet saya telah menempah dos vaksin cukup untuk semua rakyat Malaysia. Kadar vaksinasi kita antara yang tertinggi dan pantas di dunia. Saya yakin kita dapat keluar daripada kemelut pandemik ini secepat mungkin.Mahiaddin yakin bahawa Malaysia akan pulih dari wabak ini dengan mengatakan bahawa pesakit kategori 4 dan 5 telah menurun di hospital di sekitar Lembah Klang.Beliau juga mengucapkan terima kasih kepada petugas barisan hadapan dengan mengatakan bahawa mereka telah memberikan segalanya untuk memerangi wabak ini.Saya ingin memohon maaf atas kesilapan dan kelemahan saya dalam memerintah. Saya dah ahli jemaah menteri yang lagi sudah buat yang terbaik untuk hadapi krisis yang kita hadapi ketika ini. Saya berharap kerajaan baharu dapat dibentuk dengan segera supaya negara dapat berjalan seperti biasa.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: There’s A Rising Trend Of Covid-19 Deaths In Pregnant Woman And It’s Scary
Content: 70 pregnant mothers have died due to Covid-19 complications this year.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The news of celebrated singer Siti Sarah passing away due to Covid-19 shocked the nation and the news that made headlines across the world was how it happened after she gave birth and never got to hold her baby.Siti Sarah was eight months pregnant. Unfortunately, she was also unvaccinated.In a recent statement by Health Director-General Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah, the rise first became apparent in October last year with an average of 200 pregnant mothers catching the virus in the following months thereafter.Seven months later in May this year, the number more than quadrupled with 850 expectant mothers infected and there were 899 cases reported in June.Of those who are in intensive care, there has been an increase from 3% on 10 July to 5.3% on 7 August.Dr Noor Hisham pointed out that while only 1 in 220 cases of infection involved pregnant women, they are over-represented in the ICU.“The ratio of Covid-19-infected pregnant women receiving intensive care, compared to the total number of critical Covid-19-infected patients, is 1 in 20,” he said.Dr Noor Hisham reports the first rise of deaths in expectant mothers was detected in June with 17 reported. Among the deaths were two mothers who received only one dose of the Covid1-9 vaccine and the other 15 were unvaccinated.47% of those deaths had some form of comorbidity.As of 8 August, the MoH has recorded a total of 146,759 pregnant mothers who have registered for the Covid-19 vaccine on MySejahtera with 83,251 who have received at least one dose of the vaccine. However, only 20% have completed both doses.Studies have shown an increased risk of developing severe Covid-19 if they are infected, compared with non-pregnant women of a similar age.In a report by the Malay Mail, based on the estimated number of pregnant women a year, the percentage of pregnant women who registered to get vaccinated on the MySejahtera application is still low, at 40%.Although a personal choice, the Special Committee on Ensuring Access To Covid-19 Vaccine Supply (JKJAV) notes that the risk of contracting a Covid-19 infection outweighs the risk of the vaccine and that every pregnant woman should consider getting vaccinated.The vaccination should be administered between 14 to 33 weeks of gestation.If in doubt, consult your doctor to enable you to make an informed decision.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Stage Two Cancer Patient Determined To Take Covid-19 Vaccination
Content: He is currently undergoing chemotherapy for cancer and has referred to a doctor to seek clarification on vaccination risks in chronic patients.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Malaysians are in danger.Why? Because of the Covid-19 variants Delta and Delta Plus emerging, as confirmed by the Ministry of Health (MOH).For those who don’t know, the Delta Variant is spreading fast, resulting in a surge of new Covid-19 cases worldwide.Read more: 15 Seconds Is All The Delta Variant Needs To Infect You Says Health DGThis variant poses the “biggest threat” yet and has been reported in almost 100 countries. It is currently the most prevailing of Covid-19 variants – especially in counties like the United Kingdom, Portugal, South Africa, and Russia.Now another variant, the Lambda, has emerged. It was first discovered in Peru in August 2020 and has since spread throughout South America.Moral of the story? This is why Covid-19 vaccinations are so important.In a report by Astro Awani, an elderly man known as Mohd Ibrahim Osman has voluntarily received the Covid-19 vaccination.Ibrahim, who also suffers from stage two liver cancer, was determined to prepare himself with the immunisation shot for his protection.The 70-year-old is currently undergoing chemotherapy for his cancer and consulted with a doctor to seek clarification on the risks vaccinations may have for chronic patients like himself.He has successfully completed both vaccination doses.According to the Clinical Guidelines on Covid-19 Vaccination in Malaysia released by MOH, even those with an incurable illness such as metastatic cancer are still recommended to get the Covid-19 vaccination unless the person is actively deteriorating with an estimated survival of less than 1 month.Although data on safety for cancer patients is limited, there are many examples of vaccinations for vulnerable patients, including cancer patients in countries which rolled out the Covid-19 vaccine much earlier than Malaysia, that proved the benefits outweigh the possible adverse effects. MOH’s guidelines therefore considers it beneficial for patients with underlying cancers to receive the Covid-19 vaccination.If in doubt, speak to your oncologist.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: [Video] Situasi Di PPV Hotel Grand Seasons, Pihak Rumah Prihatin Tampil Beri Penjelasan
Content:
Lokasi Rumah Prihatin@Grand Seasons ini terletak berhadapan Hospital Kuala Lumpur (HKL) di mana pesakit Covid-19 menerima rawatan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Semalam (11 Ogos), satu video pelanggaran SOP telah membanjiri media sosial setelah ianya dimuat naik oleh pengguna Instagram iaitu @bondaumirahtaib.Video berdurasi 7 minit itu diambil dari luar Rumah Prihatian@Grand Seasons yang juga merupakan Hotel Kebajikan pertama di Malaysia yang diuruskan oleh Yayasan Wilayah Persekutuan dengan kerjasama Hotel Grand Seasons, Hotel Pulse Grande – anak syarikat Perbadanan Putrajaya, Dewan Bandaraya Kuala Lumpur dan Sukarelawan Wilayah Prihatin (PriVo).Tonton video penuh di bawah:A post shared by Director of Le Maream (@bondaumirahtaib)Dalam video tersebut menunjukkan seorang lelaki warganegara Malaysia meluahkan rasa marah dengan keadaan sekeliling yang dilihatnya di mana setiap individu yang beratur untuk mendapatkan vaksin secara (walk-in) langsung tidak mematuhi SOP.Beratur terlalu dekat seolah-olah ingin memeluk individu yang berada di hadapan.Pada minit ke 1:18, lelaki ini turut menyeru Menteri Kanan Perdagangan Antarabangsa dan Industri, Datuk Seri Mohamed Azmin Ali untuk melakukan sesuatu.“Azmin Ali, you do something brother!” katanya dalam video tersebut.Dia turut meluahkan rasa kesal terhadap pihak berkuasa yang datang sejurus selepas itu untuk meredakan keadaan, namun apa yang difokuskan adalah motor milik lelaki ini yang dikatakan terletak di atas garisan kuning.“Ini hal kecik je motor ni. Hal besar ini yang tengah beratur ni cik,” jelas individu tersebut dengan nada yang begitu prihatin dan kesal.Menurut netizen, kejadian ini telah berlaku berhari-hari namun masih belum tular dan tiada apa-apa tindakan pernah diambil sebelum ini.I lalu depan GS last Monday sebab hantar my parents vax kt PWTC. The queue sama je mcm yg viral this morning. No gap at all. Means bukan baru harini je tau SOP dia kelaut 😓Boleh je buat kerja. Ingat susah. Bila orang rakam marah tapi kalau tak viral tak buat kerja. Patut la orang Malaysia gila merakam, gila viral. Viral > Kuasa PolisCikgu matematik ‘turun padang’.Lelaki tersebut yang dikenali sebagai Shakib dan team @mcplus_my yang juga merupakan tenaga pengajar math clinic telah turun padang pada waktu malam, hari yang sama untuk membantu kerja-kerja berkaitan pematuhan  SOP dan penjarakan sosial di PPV tersebut.A post shared by MCplus (@mcplus.my)math clinic ni job scope diaorang bukan jaga ppv tau. diaorang ada online class and dieorang ni tenaga pengajar. malam tadi dieorang dah bantu buat line untuk sop dah Alhamdulillah . harini biar lah pdrm and dbkl buat kerja pula sebab tu memang tugas diaorang.bangga aku rasa pernah jadi student sir Shakib dekat mathclinic seksyen 9, 8 tahun lepas. dulu dia bawak motor bmw apa ntah fav aku tu. masih bergaya sekarang sir, fuhhSemoga amal kebaikan mereka ini dapat memberi manfaat kepada orang ramai yang bakal hadir ke PPV itu pada hari-hari seterusnya.Terbaik, team mcplus.my!Setelah tularnya video tersebut, pihak Rumah Prihatin tidak terlepas untuk memberikan penjelasan mengenai isu tersebut.Menurut pihak mereka, perkara ini berlaku berpunca dari salah faham dan berita kononnya Rumah Prihatin tersebut menyediakan perkhidmatan daftar terus (Walk-in) vaksin untuk warga asing.Sedangkan pengambilan vaksin secara walk-in untuk warga asing adalah di PPV Bukit Jalil sahaja.Pihak mereka turut memohon maaf dan kesal dengan apa yang terjadi. Malah, mereka juga akan meningkatkan lagi pematuhan prosedur operasi standard (SOP) supaya kejadian yang sama tidak berulang lagi.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Menggelupur ‘Cari Nyawa’. Ibu Hamil Ini Kongsi Pengalaman Diserang Covid-19
Content:
Nak cuba buka oksigen dari mulut pun tak boleh, sampaikan terkapai-kapai mencari ‘nyawa’.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Beberapa hari yang lalu, Malaysia dikejutkan dengan pemergian selebriti terkenal tanah air, Siti Sarah Raissuddin yang telah pergi menghadap Ilahi pada 9 Ogos 2021.Inna Lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji’un.Siti Sarah, suami yang juga pelawak, Shuib serta seluruh keluarganya telah disahkan positif Covid-19 pada 27 Julai lalu.Arwah dimasukkan ke Unit Rawatan Rapi (ICU) hospital itu selepas tahap oksigen menurun. Arwah kemudiannya ditidurkan sebelum pembedahan dijalankan bagi mengeluarkan bayi dalam kandungan dan akhirnya selamat melahirkan bayi lelaki, Ayash Affan.BACA SINI: Kenali Siti Sarah Raisuddin: Pemergian Yang Beri Kesan Kepada Orang Ramai“Perit tak terkata.”Itu antara perkataan yang keluar untuk memberikan gambaran betapa Covid-19 ini adalah benar dan tidak boleh diambil mudah dan ringan. Terlalu bahaya, lebih-lebih lagi buat ibu hamil di luar sana.Satu perkongsian melalui Aplikasi Telegram telah diambil melalui screenshot dan dikongsikan oleh pengguna Facebook Azie Abdullah bertujuan untuk dijadikan pengajaran buat orang ramai mengenai peritnya diserang virus merbahaya ini.Nota: Perkongsian ini memang agak panjang, anda boleh refer satu per satu melalui screenshot yang dikongsikan untuk memahami lebih lanjut tentang prosedur pihak hospital merawat pesakit Covid-19 ini.Bayangkan, merawat pesakit Covid-19 yang hamil bukanlah sesuatu yang mudah. Doktor perlu mendahulukan si ibu supaya mereka dapat memberikan oksigen kepada bayi mereka.Pelatih Pakar Bedah iaitu Dr. Amalina Che Bakri menasihati wanita hamil mendapatkan vaksin Covid-19 secepat mungkin berikutan golongan itu berisiko tinggi mendapat jangkitan teruk, melahirkan bayi pramatang atau kematian.Menurutnya, kajian melibatkan 7,530 wanita hamil menerima vaksin dan 7,530 tidak divaksin menunjukkan bahawa yang sudah divaksin kurang berisiko untuk mendapat jangkitan berbanding mereka yang tidak divaksin.Setakat ini seramai 130,000 wanita hamil di Amerika Syarikat (AS) dan 50,000 di United Kingdom (UK) sudah mendapat vaksin, tanpa ada isu keselamatan terhadap ibu dan bayi. Ia menunjukkan vaksin adalah selamat untuk ibu mengandung dan kandungan. Data dari UK menunjukkan ibu mengandung yang mendapat dua dos lengkap tidak dimasukkan ke hospital kerana Covid-19 kerana mereka sudah mendapat perlindungan, sebaliknya mereka yang mendapat jangkitan teruk adalah yang tidak divaksin atau belum mendapat dos kedua.Tambahnya lagi, memetik Kajian Kolej Diraja Obstetrik dan Ginekologi (RCOG) telah mendedahkan bahawa vaksin boleh diberi kepada ibu mengandung tidak kira tahap kehamilan.Wanita mengandung perlu melengkapkan dua dos sebelum melahirkan atau sebelum masuk trimester ketiga kerana ini adalah peringkat yang paling genting.Pada tahap ini risiko paling tinggi tanpa mengira umur wanita hamil. Justeru golongan ini digalakkan untuk mendapat vaksin kerana risiko yang tinggi kepada mereka. Untuk di Malaysia, mereka boleh berbincang dengan Pakar Obstetrik & Ginekologi (O&G) untuk berbincang mengenai kebaikan dan risiko.Untuk ibu mengandung di luar sana yang masih belum mendapatkan temu janji vaksinasi, boleh refer perkongsian di bawah:📢 For pregnant (30-32 weeks) and breastfeeding mums w high risks (dr’s letter needed).Someone I know sent this lady a DM on Instagram and got an appointment soon after. She says she’s part of a mother’s group organising to help get pregnant women vaxed.Instagram: darlamzin pic.twitter.com/5VTB2r3XP6Semoga kita semua dijauhkan daripada virus yang membunuh ini.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Awas! Varian Delta Cepat Merebak, Tapi Varian Lambda Membimbangkan Juga
Content:
Varian Lambda ini telah ditemui di Peru pada bulan Ogos 2020 dan telah mulai merebak di Amerika Selatan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Dunia kini berada dalam bahaya.Ini kerana Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) baru mengesahkan bahawa selepas kehadiran varian Delta dan Delta Plus, satu lagi varian baharu telah dikesan di Peru dan Jepun iaitu varian Lambda.Untuk pengetahuan anda, Varian Delta adalah yang paling cepat merebak dan turut mengakibatkan lonjakan kes baharu Covid-19 di serata dunia. Varian itu yang dianggap ‘ancaman terbesar’ dilapor telah menular di hampir 100 negara sekali gus menjadi varian Covid-19 dominan ketika ini terutama di negara seperti UK, Portugal, Afrika Selatan, dan Rusia.Varian Delta pada asalnya digelar sebagai B.1.617.2 itu pertama kali dikesan di Maharashtra, barat India pada Oktober tahun lalu.BACA JUGA: Varian Delta Boleh Merebak Sepantas 15 Saat – Dr Noor HishamMenurut laporan Japan Times, varian Lamba ini telah ditemui di Peru pada bulan Ogos 2020 dan telah mulai merebak di Amerika Selatan.Kenyataan mengenai varian Lambda ini telah disahkan oleh Tan Sri Dr Noor Hishahm Abdullah menerusi laman Facebook beliau yang memaklumkan varian ini lebih mudah berjangkit serta lebih kuat dalam melawan imuniti individu yang sudah divaksin.Kes ini mulai dikesan di Jepun di mana seorang wanita di Lapangan Terbang Haneda yang tiba dari Peru pada 20 Julai lalu telah disahkan positif Covid-19.Walau bagaimanapun, wanita tersebut tidak mengalami sebarang simptom.Virus itu telah disahkan sebagai varian Lambda dalam analisis yang dikeluarkan oleh Institut Penyakit Berjangkit Nasional.Setakat ini, kajian berkenaan varian Lambda ini masih dijalankan untuk mengetahui lebih perinciannya.BACA JUGA: Beware! Ini Simptom Varian Delta Yang Perlu DiketahuiKongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: New Norm: Kes Kian Tinggi, Ini 3 Kaedah Baca Jumlah Kes Harian Positif Covid-19
Content:
Jangan fokus kepada bilangan kes harian, lihat juga peratusan dalam setiap kategori.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Kenaikan kes positif Covid-19 di Malaysia sehingga hari ini telah memberi impak yang begitu mendalam buat rakyat.Bulan lalu, Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) memperkenalkan infografik baharu yang menunjukkan kes-kes Covid-19 baharu berdasarkan kategori, dan turut menekankan peratusan individu yang TIDAK DIVAKSINASI dalam setiap kategori tersebut.Ternyata, segelintir individu terlalu fokus kepada peningkatan jumlah kes baharu apabila mereka seharusnya memberi lebih perhatian terhadap peratusan individu yang telah diberikan vaksin.Perkara ini bukan sahaja telah diberitahu dalam catatan oleh Dr Tash Karan, tetapi seorang pengguna Facebook Tai Zee Kin kini juga turut memberikan panduan ringkas mengenai kaedah baharu untuk membaca jumlah kes harian.Kategori 4 dan 5 adalah kes-kes yang memerlukan hospitalisasi. Nombor ini menyumbang kepada masalah kekurangan kapasiti hospital.Kategori 1 dan 2 pula melibatkan kes-kes yang tidak memerlukan hospitalisasi. Kategori 1 terdiri daripada mereka yang tidak tahu bahawa mereka ada COVID-19. Setelah didapati positif COVID-19, mereka diarah supaya menjalani kuarantin kendiri, dan dikehendaki untuk mengemaskinikan maklumat simptom-simptom melalui aplikasi MySejahtera setiap hari.Kebanyakan pesakit COVID-19 dalam Kategori 4 & 5, (90% dan ke atas) terdiri daripada mereka yang belum lagi divaksinasi. Selebihnya (10%) mungkin baru sahaja menerima dos kedua tetapi belum mendapat perlindungan penuh (kurang daripada 2 minggu), ataupun yang hanya dapat 1 dos. Pesakit COVID-19 yang mendapat kedua-dua dos dan perlindungan penuh (selepas 2 minggu) adalah sangat minima.Pendekatan ini bukan konklusif, dan hanya boleh dirujuk secara kasar untuk memantau kandungan oksigen darah.98.2% daripada 19,819 pesakit COVID-19 yang dikesan adalah tanpa simptom, atau hanya mengalami simptom serupa dengan selesema.BACA JUGA: Higher Infection Rates But “Very Low” Death Rates Is A Good Sign Of Curbing Covid-19Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: [Foto] Kompilasi Warga Perlis Dine-in Buat Warganet ‘Tersakiti’
Content:
Mampu tengok dan doa dari jauh je nampaknya. 🙁Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Umum sedia maklum bahawa Perlis, Sarawak dan Wilayah Persekutuan Labuan sudah mula beralih ke Fasa 3 Kawalan Pergerakan dalam Pelan Pemulihan Negara (PPN) mulai semalam (4 Ogos 2021).Peralihan fasa tersebut diumumkan Perdana Menteri Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yasin selepas penelitian perkembangan semasa PPN yang dibentangkan Menteri Penyelaras PPN Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz.Menurut laporan, berdasarkan Prosedur Operasi Standard (SOP) yang pernah dijelaskan oleh Timbalan Perdana Menteri Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob, terdapat beberapa kelonggaran mula diberikan dalam Fasa 3 PPN.Antaranya adalah semua aktiviti ekonomi dibenarkan beroperasi kecuali aktiviti yang berisiko tinggi dan disenaraikan dalam senarai negatif seperti pub dan kelab malam.Semestinya, yang paling dinanti-nantikan adalah makan di restoran dibenarkan terhad kepada dua orang satu meja dengan mematuhi penjarakan fizikal bagi tempoh tersebut.🙁Bermula semalam, media sosial dibanjiri oleh rakyat Perlis yang mulai berkongsikan momen di mana mereka sudah mula dine-in di restoran dan kedai makan di negeri tersebut.Jealous betul. Tapi apakan daya, masih belum mampu tandingi rakyat Perlis.Salam dine-in dari Perlis. pic.twitter.com/MJY64eXXPkHari pertama lepas bapa puluh hari tak boleh dine in #perlisdinein pic.twitter.com/H6SgKarJCASushi king, Kangar pic.twitter.com/vwFQstAcG6Semalam lepas teman akak pergi vaksin, terus dia ajak dine in dekat sushi king 😆😆😆 pic.twitter.com/GWLkGLEqiQmkn roti canai dkt kedai pic.twitter.com/R4FPlQqQIMTapi apa pun, buat warga Perlis – syabas dan terus ikuti SOP yang diberikan okay. Nanti giliran kami pula menyusul.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: KJ: Klang Valley Vaccinations Successful, Next Is The Rest Of The Country
Content: Everyone who was left behind will be vaccinated within the first week of August.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.National Covid-19 Immunization Program (PICK) Minister Khairy Jamaluddin today (2 August) announced the successful end of Operation Surge Capacity – a program implemented with the aim to get as many adults in Kuala Lumpur and Selangor vaccinated with the first dose of the coronavirus vaccine as soon as possible.The operation which began from 26 July till 1 August had sent out more than 1.6 million vaccination appointments to residents in the Klang Valley, and as of date, 96.7% of adults here have been vaccinated once while 37.5% have been fully vaccinated.Although the program was shy of its target of reaching a full 100% adult vaccination rate in the Klang Valley, KJ explained that we will try to vaccinate everyone who was “left behind” by the first week of August.Some of these people might have canceled or were absent for their vaccination appointments.He said that these individuals will promptly receive their rescheduled vaccination appointments or choose to walk-in for injections at designated Covid-19 Vaccination Centers (PPV).KJ said that the next step for Klang Valley was to ‘mop up’ and ensure that everyone, including those who have not registered for the vaccine, to be inoculated via walk-ins and mobile community outreach programs in rural communities.Priority will be given to the elderly and individuals with comorbidities or critical illness.KJ also added that separate PPV centers will be opened for Malaysian citizens and foreigners for better crowd control.The Minister stressed that walk-in vaccinations in the Klang Valley are only open to Klang Valley residents.Residents over the age of 40 who have not yet received their vaccination appointments or previously cancelled their appointments can walk-in to one of nine PPVs designated for the processVaksinasi secara walk-in di Lembah Klang bermula hari ini bagi Warganegara Malaysia berusia 40 tahun ke atas atau komorbid. Walk-in bermula jam 2 petang di setiap PPV berikut secara first-come-first-serve. pic.twitter.com/08H8hjSaHTSenior citizens, however, can walk-in to any PPVs in the Klang Valley to get vaccinated.The mop up campaign will go on till 22 August in hopes to get the remaining 3% of Klang Valley’s adult population vaccinated.KJ explained that as of date, 95% of elderly people across the country have registered to receive the vaccine and PPVs nationwide will begin accepting walk-ins for senior citizens next week.PICK now targets to vaccinate at least 40% of the adult population in each individual state across the country by the end of August.Vaccination distributions nationwide will be based on two criteria so that states that have fallen behind can catch up;Read More: Half Of Malaysian Adults Will Be Vaccinated By MerdekaAccording to Malaysia’s National Recovery Plan that had been laid out by the Prime Minister Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md. Yassin, the country aims to inoculate 60% of the population by December 2021.Health Director-General Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah was confident that Malaysia can immunize 80% of our population by September this year.Read More: There Are 4 Phases Planned For The Country To Recover From Covid-19Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Half Of Malaysian Adults Will Be Vaccinated By Merdeka
Content: The target is to vaccinate all of the country’s adults by October 2021.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Half of Malaysian adults will be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 by Merdeka.With 59% of the population having already received their first vaccine shot, National Covid-19 Immunization Program (PICK) Minister Khairy Jamaluddin is positive that Malaysia is on target to fully vaccinate 50% of denizens over the age of 18 by 31 August 2021.Currently, 29% of the country’s adults have completed both vaccine doses, and as of 1 August, around 13.8 million people have gotten their first jabs while another 6.7 million have been fully vaccinated.Aktiviti pengharmonian data mingguan telah dijalankan. Data hari ini telah mengambil kira sepenuhnya pelaporan manual termasuk daripada program jangkau luar komuniti yang dijalankan di seluruh negara. pic.twitter.com/QEa6u2GzYLMalaysia had in July begun to ramp up PICK following the emergence of new Covid-19 variants.The PM previously mentioned that we are aiming to completely vaccinate 100% of our adult population by October and;Khairy added that the government was also reviewing new ‘relaxed’ standard operating procedures (SOP) for people who’ve been completely vaccinated and any updates will soon be announced by the Prime Minister Tan Sri Mahiaddin Md. Yasin.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: [UPDATE] Walk-In Vaccination In Klang Valley Delayed For A Day
Content: Those who are qualified for walk-in vaccination can do so starting Monday, 2 August instead.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Those who have not been vaccinated, starting with those above 40 and people with comorbidities can get vaccinated at selected Vaccination Centres (PPVs) without an appointment in Klang Valley starting 2 August, instead of 1 August. The National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (NIP) Coordinating Minister Khairy Jamaluddin added in a report that walk-in vaccination will be offered to those above 18 years-old starting 5 August. The list of vaccination centres that would offer walk-in vaccinations will be issued by the Covid-19 Immunisation Task Force (CITF) today. He noted that vaccinations offered are on a “first-come-first-serve” basis and will depend on the PPV’s capacity. We are confident that by tomorrow, 99% of adults in the Klang Valley will receive their appointments.READ MORE:Walk-in Vaccinations Available For 60YO+ In Klang Valley TODAY (17 July)Vaccination Centres (PPV) that will be accepting walk-ins from 2nd August. Please bring the relevant documents with you. pic.twitter.com/ZwIKAhbQq6Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: You Can Now Buy Covid-19 Home Test Kits On MySejahtera Plus Other Fancy New Functions
Content: A quick way to see if you have the updated app is if it has 9 icons at the top. The old one only had 6.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The latest update to the MySejahtera mobile application now allows Malaysians to purchase Covid-19 self-test kits, locate a nearby health screening facility and directly get in touch with emergency services.Through the app, denizens are currently given the option to purchase three different types of Covid-19 test kits via the Pharma2u e-store and also allow corporations to buy them in bulk;The Pharma2u website also lists a fourth test kit available for purchase;Just simply open your MySejahtera app to be prompted with an ‘update now’ notification and follow the instructions.After the update, three new icons should be available on your app.Just remember that clicking on the Emergency (SOS) icon will connect you directly to 999, so it’s best not to abuse it.Dear users, we have updated the mobile app with enhanced features earlier this morning. Please update your app to the latest version. Close and reopen the app after update and you will be able to experience the latest features.Thank youThe MySejahtera update also comes with a new consent form that needs to be filled up by those receiving appointments for their first dose of the Covid-19 vaccines.According to the Special Committee On Covid-19 Vaccine Supply (JKJAV), for people who’ve already received their first vaccine shot and signed their consent form manually, you don’t need to fill up this new digital form.New feature on @my_sejahtera. This digital consent form only applies to first dose appointment.For those who have received their first dose vaccine and have signed their consent form manually, you don’t need to fill up this digital form. pic.twitter.com/MpfmOwcTHjShare your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Nama Penuh Gadis Ini Badjie Xatieqoutieqc Ibadallah. Cuba Sebut, Boleh?
Content:
Kami dah cuba sebut, failed.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Tidak dinafikan, zaman sekarang ini memang banyak nama-nama unik yang telah didaftarkan. Ada yang suka nama klasik, ada yang suka nama modern, malah ada juga yang suka nama unik.Unik maksudnya, jarang digunakan.Tapi masih mempunyai maksud di sebaliknya.Jika anda masih mencari-cari nama untuk bakal cahaya mata, boleh lihat di sini. Mana tahu ada yang berkenan.Baru-baru ini telah viral satu tweet di mana seorang pengguna Twitter @wayom_ telah memuat naik satu perkongsian menunjukkan nama sebenar rakannya yang boleh dikatakan paling unik pernah kami dengari.Ejaan dan sebutan pun memang luar biasa.Wehh korang tengok nama member aku selama ni panggil Belle ingat kan full name Nabila. Sekali engko haaa nahh gasak bakal suami ni akad nikah nanti 😂😂 pic.twitter.com/UAnI42PGxoKalau nak tahu cara sebutan yang betul, boleh dengar sendiri empunya nama sebut:Haaa nah ni sebut la korang aku suruh dia ulang 10 kali pun aku tak boleh sebut 😂😂😂😂 pic.twitter.com/vSjfc9WPqGHa, korang boleh sebut dalam satu nafas?Badjie Xatieqoutieqc Ibadallah, 28, menjelaskan kepada Harian Metro bahawa  memang sukar membesar dengan nama ini kerana kerap diejek namun lama-kelamaan dia belajar menerima dan menyukainya.Badjie Xatieqoutieqc yang juga bekas pramugari Malaysia Airlines Bhd berkata, selain namanya sukar disebut, rata-rata yang mengetahui namanya juga sering mempersoalkan asal-usul nama itu.Mereka tujuh beradik diberi nama Badjie Xietaqieullah, Badjie Xbietaquauallah, Badjie Xatieqieullah, Badjie Xatieqoutieqc (dirinya), Badjie Xaebcourieyiean, Badjie Xieslammillatiena dan Badjie Xwattaquoallah.Nama ‘Badjie’ adalah gabungan nama kedua orang tua saya sebagai menggantikan nama ‘Raden’ yang dulunya diwarisi turun temurun daripada nenek moyang kami (Jawa Sunda). Memang kedengaran pelik, tapi itulah pendirian bapa saya yang mempunyai cita rasa unik dalam memilih nama anak-anaknya agar lain daripada yang lain.Menurutnya, nama tujuh adik-beradiknya jika dibaca dengan betul sebenarnya membawa maksud bertakwa kepada Allah.Menurutnya, bapanya adalah seorang jurutera yang suka berfikir di luar kotak dalam suatu hal. Malah, dalam soal nama mereka, bapanya seolah-olah menggunakan ‘kod rahsia’ dalam menyuruh mereka adik-beradik agar sentiasa bertakwa kepada-Nya.Panggil saja saya Belle kerana ia juga membawa maksud yang baik. Kalau ikutkan saya nak orang panggil Xatieqoutieqc tapi akan jadi susah.Untuk pengetahuan anda, Badjie Xatieqoutieqc kini menjadi anggota sukarelawan Pusat Pemberian Vaksin (PPV) di Setia City Convention Centre (SCCC), Shah Alam, Selangor.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Cara Renew Lesen Waktu PKP. 15 Minit Je Boleh Setel!
Content:
Mudah, dan cepat.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Waktu-waktu PKP ni, drive pun dekat-dekat je untuk beli makanan. Paling jauh pun mungkin masa pergi ke Pusat Pemberian Vaksin (PPV) untuk ambil vaksin.Tup tap, tanpa disedari lesen memandu dah tamat tempoh.Alamak, nak kena beratur panjang kat JPJ ke?Jawapannya, tak perlu. Anda boleh renew secara online, dalam masa 15 minit dah boleh setel.No hustle!Itu sahaja proses yang perlu dibuat. Senang, kan?Nanti dalam masa 2 hingga 5 hari, lesen memandu yang telah diperbaharui akan sampai ke rumah.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: 92% Of Covid-19 Patients Were Not Vaccinated, Says Health DG
Content: 97.9% of the 5 stage cases reported yesterday didn’t have any vaccination history.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The Health Ministry has revealed that 92% of newly diagnosed Covid-19 cases were individuals who were not vaccinated.Health Director-General Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah also said in a statement that out of 14,516 cases that were reported yesterday, 95 cases (0.7%) were categorised under stage 5. Out of that number, 97.9% of the cases had no vaccination history.According to the Health Ministry, stage 5 patients are categorised as those who have respiratory failure and require mechanical ventilation.He urged the public to get vaccinated as soon as possible to protect themselves and their loved ones.As of 26 July, the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (JKJAV) reported that 521,923 vaccines (333,621 first dose, 188,302 second dose) have been administerd in the country.Selangor has the highest number of vaccinations – rolling out 83,100 first doses and 47,087 second doses – followed by Kuala Lumpur (51,136 first dose, 34,511 second dose) and Johor (41,719 first dose, 43,888 second dose).Cumulatively, Malaysia is nearing the 20 million mark with 17,839,476 doses administered as of 26 July based on the stats by JKJAV.Total cumulative dose administered as of 26 July#LindungDiriLindungSemua pic.twitter.com/FmWGhMAlNOShare us your thoughts on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Labuan Jadi Wilayah Persekutuan Pertama Capai Imuniti Kelompok Bendung Covid-19
Content:
Setakat semalam (26 Julai), Labuan merekodkan jumlah kumulatif 9,607 kes dan 146 kematian akibat Covid-19. Lapan kes dicatat semalam namun tiada kematian dilaporkan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Labuan hari ini telah selesai memberikan vaksinasi penuh kepada 80% populasi dewasa – menjadikan pulau bebas cukai itu sebagai Wilayah Persekutuan pertama di Malaysia mencapai imuniti kelompok bagi membendung penularan Covid-19.BACA JUGA: Keputusan Suntikan Vaksin Ketiga Akan Diumumkan Tak Lama Lagi – KJMenurut laporan yang dikeluarkan oleh Astro Awani, Labuan telah memberi suntikan vaksin kepada 54,800 daripada 68,500 penduduk dewasa.Pengerusi CITF Labuan Rithuan Ismail berkata sebanyak 54,800 (80%) daripada jumlah populasi yang layak telah menerima dua dos vaksin.Pencapaian itu adalah kejayaan penduduk di pulau ini yang peka terhadap kepentingan vaksinasi Covid-19, serta kerja berpasukan daripada pasukan petugas khas dan masyarakat sebagai sukarelawan yang dinamakan Privo Team (Prihatin Volunteers). Jumlah penduduk yang divaksin pada Jun kurang daripada 14,000 tetapi meningkat dengan drastik kepada 40,800 dalam masa 37 hari dan (terus meningkat) hari ini.Program vaksinasi di Labuan berjalan lancar walaupun terdapat peningkatan jumlah kes dan kemunculan Varian Delta.BACA JUGA: Beware! Ini Simptom Varian Delta Yang Perlu DiketahuiSetakat semalam (26 Julai), Labuan merekodkan jumlah kumulatif 9,607 kes dan 146 kematian akibat Covid-19. Lapan kes dicatat semalam namun tiada kematian dilaporkan.CITF Labuan merekodkan 95.7% atau 65,521 daripada 68,500 populasi dewasa menerima suntikan dos pertama vaksin setakat semalam.Bagi mempercepatkan pencapaian imuniti kelompok, CITF dan JPBN Labuan (diketuai oleh personel Jabatan Kesihatan Labuan) telah memperluaskan program itu dengan menjalankan vaksinasi dari rumah ke rumah untuk memberikan suntikan kepada orang kurang upaya (OKU) dan mereka yang terlantar sakit.Kami juga melaksanakan vaksinasi pandu lalu dan ‘walk-in’ yang dikendalikan oleh Majlis Perwakilan Penduduk, menyaksikan ramai penduduk dari 27 kampung datang ke PPV, dan menambah Labuan mempunyai sembilan PPV termasuk satu di terminal feri antarabangsa untuk pekerja dalam sektor perkapalan, serta minyak dan gas.Pengarah Kesihatan Labuan Dr Ismuni Bohari berkata penduduk Labuan harus bersedia untuk hidup dengan Covid-19 dan yang paling penting mereka perlu terus mematuhi prosedur operasi standard (SOP).Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Raja Arab Saudi Titah Untuk Salur Bantuan Segera Buat Malaysia
Content:
Bantuan itu adalah termasuk satu juta dos vaksin Covid-19, peralatan perubatan, penjagaan dan rawatan, bekalan pencegahan dan lain-lain keperluan perubatan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Semalam (25 Julai), Raja Arab Saudi Raja Salman Abdulaziz Al Saud menitahkan supaya King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Center (KSrelief) segera menyalurkan sumbangan peralatan perubatan dan sebarang keperluan demi membantu Malaysia menangani cabaran pandemik Covid-19.Menurut laporan yang dikeluarkan oleh Bernama, Menteri Kanan Luar Negeri Datuk Seri Hishammuddin Tun Hussein berkata bantuan disalurkan baginda itu merupakan satu penghormatan besar dan benar-benar melambangkan ketulusan Kerajaan Arab Saudi dalam menjalinkan persahabatan dengan Malaysia.Bagi pihak Kerajaan Malaysia, menjunjung kasih buat baginda RRaja Arab Saudi Raja Salman Abdulaziz Al Saud dan Kerajaan Arab Saudi atas kebaikan serta keprihatinan yang sangat mendalam ini. Insya-Allah, saya akan terus bekerjasama rapat dengan Putera Mahkota bagi memperincikan bentuk keperluan terkini yang negara perlukan sekali gus memastikan titah baginda Raja Salman ini berjalan lancar.Beliau sebelum itu mengadakan panggilan telefon dengan Mohamad Salman yang menyampaikan titah tersebut.Bantuan itu adalah termasuk satu juta dos vaksin Covid-19, peralatan perubatan, penjagaan dan rawatan, bekalan pencegahan dan lain-lain keperluan perubatan.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: You Can Take A Video Of Your Vaccination Process, Says KJ
Content: He said that it can be used as evidence if there’s disputes later on.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Vaccine recipients are allowed to record their vaccination process as evidence that they’ve received the jab, according to Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Khairy Jamaluddin. Go and film yourselves and take a video of your vaccination, so that you have hard proof and we also have hard proof that you’ve received the proper dosage for your vaccination.He also said that the current practice of health officials showing the syringe with the vaccine dose before administering the jab to the recipient will continue.Penerima vaksin boleh merakam pengalaman vaksinasi mereka di PPV. pic.twitter.com/GCjtatOqmVIn the same press conference, he said that there are no links between empty vaccine shots and vaccine syndicates.Of those cases that have been reported, empty vaccinations have nothing to do and are not linked to any vaccine selling syndicate.Siasatan polis mendapati tiada kaitan ‘vaksin kosong’ dengan sindiket penjualan vaksin. pic.twitter.com/iCUh4HpOr5He said that multiple police reports have been lodged by Malaysians who didn’t feel any side effects after getting their jab but explained that it depends on the body’s reaction and not every one will experience the same thing.Khairy mentioned that based on investigations, the health personnel who were responsible for administering the dose said that they’ve completed the inoculation process and the ones who lodge the police report often don’t have any other evidence besides not having any side effects from the vaccine.He also said that there was only one case involving a health official at the Sungai Petani military camp where the nurse admitted to negligence. Khairy said that the nurse has been issued a warning and will go through a disciplinary process by the Health Ministry.Suntikan kosong – Tindakan tatatertib akan dikenakan terhadap seorang jururawat di Sungai Petani yang telah mengaku cuai.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Police Confirms Investigations On-Going To Sniff Out Vaccine Scammers
Content: Eight people have been arrested so far.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The Commercial Crime Investigation Department has confirmed that up to four police reports have been received regarding the Covid-19 vaccine issues.PDRM in a statement released on social media said that eight people have been arrested so far for to help with investigations and they have been granted bail.Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department (CCID) Director Comm Datuk Mohd Kamarudin Md Din mentioned that three reports are related to Covid-19 vaccine sales scams while another report is on the sudden increase in the number of  recipients in one of the vaccine centers (PPVs) that exceed the number of vaccines supplied.One of the investigations of these cases has been completed and the Attorney-General’s Department decided that no charges were filed after the investigation found that there was no sufficient evidence and statements to accuse the suspects.He also said that the remaining three investigation papers are still on-going and urged the public not to make any speculations regarding the investigation of these cases.The police have also detected the existence of a new scam syndicate which claims to sell Covid-19 vaccines to deceive the victims.In these cases, Kamaruddin said, the victim will be contacted by a syndicate disguised as Health Ministry officials informing that action will be taken on the victim for selling vaccines online via Facebook.To date, 38 police reports have been received regarding such cases involving losses amounting to RM54,500.00.SIARAN MEDIA PENGARAH JABATAN SIASATAN JENAYAH KOMERSILKes-kes Penipuan Berkait Vaksin COVID-19.Sumber: Jabatan Siasatan Jenayah Komersil – JSJK PDRM pic.twitter.com/0rqs4perpvShare your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used Article_Title: Dua Dos Pfizer & AstraZeneca Sama Efektif Terhadap Varian Delta
Content:
Kedua-dua jenis vaksin berkenaan dilaporkan sangat efektif terhadap Varian Delta yang dominan di seluruh dunia.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Menurut satu kajian diterbitkan semalam dalam New England Journal of Medicine, dua dos vaksin Covid-19 jenis Pfizer atau AstraZeneca hampir sama berkesan terhadap varian Delta yang sangat mudah menjangkiti.BACA JUGA: Sinovac & Pfizer Sama Efektif. Jangan MemilihVaksin berkenaan dilaporkan sangat efektif terhadap Varian Delta yang dominan di seluruh dunia walaupun kajian menegaskan bahawa satu suntikan vaksin tidak cukup untuk memberikan perlindungan maksimum.BACA JUGA: Varian Delta Boleh Merebak Sepantas 15 Saat – Dr Noor HishamMenurut laporan yang dikeluarkan oleh Berita Harian, kajian itu juga mengesahkan penemuan utama oleh Kesihatan Awam England (PHE) pada bulan Mei mengenai keberkesanan vaksin Covid-19 keluaran Pfizer-BioNTech dan Oxford-AstraZeneca.Kajian mendapati keberkesanan dua dos vaksin Pfizer mencecah 88% bagi jangkitan bergejala daripada Varian Delta – berbanding 93.7% terhadap Varian Alpha.Dua dos vaksin AstraZeneca pula berkesan sebanyak 67% terhadap Varian Delta – meningkat berbanding laporan sebelum ini. Manakala 74.5% berkesan terhadap Varian Alpha – juga meningkat berbanding jangkaan keberkesanan 66%.Hanya perbezaan sederhana dalam keberkesanan vaksin yang dicatat dengan varian Delta dibandingkan dengan varian Alpha selepas penerimaan dua dos vaksin.Sebelum ini, PHE mengatakan dos pertama daripada salah satu vaksin adalah sekitar 33% berkesan terhadap jangkitan bergejala Varian Delta.Kajian penuh yang diterbitkan semalam mendapati satu dos suntikan Pfizer adalah 36% berkesan. Manakala 30% berkesan bagi satu dos vaksin AstraZeneca.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Currently leading Bahasa desk for The Rakyat Post as the Head Writer.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Sinovac & Pfizer Sama Efektif. Jangan Memilih
Content:
Untuk pengetahuan anda, Sinovac dan Pfizer mempunyai lebih banyak persamaan dan kedua-dua vaksin ini adalah setanding.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Data perubatan menunjukkan vaksin Sinovac mempunyai kadar keberkesanan yang sama dengan Pfizer dalam melawan virus Covid-19.Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah berkongsi di laman Facebook miliknya menegaskan bahawa Sinovac dan Pfizer tidak mempunyai banyak perbezaan dan kedua-duanya berkesan dalam usaha mencegah jangkitan teruk Covid-19.Untuk pengetahuan anda, Sinovac dan Pfizer mempunyai lebih banyak persamaan dan kedua-dua vaksin ini adalah setanding.Dr Noor Hisham turut memetik kajian perubatan yang dilakukan mengenai penggunaan Sinovac di Chile dan penggunaan Pfizer di Israel.Sinovac dan Pfizer tidak mempunyai banyak perbezaan dan kedua-duanya berkesan dalam usaha mencegah jangkitan teruk Covid-19.Kajian yang diterbitkan dalam “New England Journal of Medicine” mendapati bahawa Sinovac mengurangkan jangkitan Covid-19 sebanyak 65.9%, kemasukan ke hospital sebanyak 87.5%, kemasukan ke unit rawatan intensif (ICU) sebanyak 90.3%, dan kematian sebanyak 86.3%.Selain itu, Kementerian Kesihatan Israel juga menyatakan bahawa vaksin Pfizer mengurangkan jangkitan Covid-19 sebanyak 64% dan gejala serius yang membawa kepada kemasukan hospital sebanyak 93%.Walau bagaimanapun, segelintir netizen yang prihatin menyatakan bahawa kedua-dua kajian itu tidak dilakukan pada masa yang sama. Kajian yang dilakukan untuk Pfizer dilakukan dan disimpulkan pada tahun lalu sebelum wujudnya Varian Delta.Manakala, kajian yang dilakukan untuk Sinovac pula dijalankan pada awal tahun ini.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter, dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.
