Article_Title: Selangor Says Used 80% Of Vaccines, Refuting KJ’s Claim Of Under Utilization
Content: The issue faced by Selangor is not a lack of capacity for vaccination.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.Selangor Health, Welfare, Women Empowerment and Family executive councillor Dr Siti Mariah Mahmud today refuted claims that the state was under-utilising the vaccines they have received.National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme Coordinating Minister Khairy Jamaluddin earlier today said Selangor only used 76% of 1.36 million doses of vaccines given.Dr Siti said in the statement that the State Government has taken note of the concerns raised surrounding the issue of vaccine supply in Selangor.She went on to say, “According to records, Selangor State Health Department (JKNS) received 1,189,350 doses as of 27 June 2021, with 954,051 doses distributed. Therefore, the remaining balance of around 20% is 235,277 doses. This supply is only expected to last another two days, if vaccination is carried out at vaccination centers maximum capacity.”Dr Siti said that JKNS will be receiving an additional 60,000 doses, and expressed the State Government’s gratitude.With 73 vaccination centers, she says it is important to note that the capacity of daily vaccination at centers is 87,616. However with the current supply, the daily rate is at only 53,037.“Insya-Allah, after joining hands with the Vaksin Selangor Program, which will be announced by the MB, we will be able to achieve the CITF National target as mentioned by the PICK Coordinating Minister with 135,000 and 165,000 daily doses in July and August respectively,” said Dr Siti.She ended the statement saying the issue faced by the state of Selangor is a lack of vaccine supply, and not a lack of capacity or vaccination centers.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Cuba Willing To Work With Malaysia To Make Covid-19 Vaccines, Says Ambassador
Content: They have made 5 types of vaccines, so far.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Cuba is ready to collaborate with Malaysia to produce new products and medicines, including the Covid-19 vaccine, said its Ambassador to Malaysia, Florentino Batista-González.He said two locally made Covid-19 vaccines – the Soberana 2 and Abdala, have been used for their population and are proven to be effective.The Caribbean island nation took a different route in inoculating their population, choosing not to depend on foreign imports but banking on their own biotechnological and pharmaceutical advances instead and relying on locally produced vaccines.The results are clear, cases have dropped by 50% in areas where the population has been vaccinated, and the number of critical patients as well as deaths has also dropped significantly.Recently, the country revealed that the Abdala vaccine which comes with three injections is now in a final phase clinical trial and is 92.28% effective against the Covid-19 virus, while Soberana showed an effectiveness of 62%.So far, Cuba has punched above their weight and made five types of vaccines:As of June 17, more than 5 million Cubans have received at least one dose of the vaccine and by August, more than eight million are expected to be fully vaccinated and it’s reported that their total population is around 11 million.Meanwhile, in Malaysia, around 4,574,685 individuals have received their first vaccine dose and from that number, 1,727,042 people have received the second dose – which means that about 5.3% of the population have received both doses.It’s reported that 10% of Malaysia’s population will be vaccinated by mid-July.Malaysia is also trying to make their own vaccines and this is done by the Institute for Medical Research (IMR), according to reports by The Star.Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Adham Baba said that we’re actually making two types of vaccines – ribonucleic acid vaccines or messenger RNA vaccines (mRNA), and inactivated vaccines.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Malaysia Could Enter Phase 2 By Mid-July
Content: Khairy Jamaluddin blames hoarders for vaccine inequity and slow rollout.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.The coordinating minister for the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (NIP), Khairy Jamaluddin, says Malaysia can expect more than 10% of its population or 3.2 million people, to be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 by mid-July. At the same time, he lashed out against countries that he claims are hoarding the vaccines.Khairy admits that supply has always been the constraint in the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme. It is also the reason why the mega vaccination centres (PPVs) were established relatively late in the programme.According to the government’s projections, about 10.7 million doses would have been administered by mid-July. Khairy added that the government is aiming for 8 million doses to be administered in June to reach that target. That is considering that out of roughly every 100 doses administered, 30 are second doses.As of 22 June, A total of 6,301,727 doses of Covid-19 vaccines have been administered. 4,574,685 or 14% of the population have had their first dose and 1,727,042 or 5.3% of the population have had their are second dose.The numbers also show that Malaysia is already more than halfway towards reaching the predicted 10% vaccinated rate. Total cumulative dose administered as of 22 JuneRegister for vaccination: https://t.co/8VAVxoazYq#LindungDiriLindungSemua pic.twitter.com/1fRGKIYwmOWith 10% of the population vaccinated, if the daily new cases of Covid-19 drops below 4,000 and the healthcare system is not in a critical stage, the country would enter phase two of the National Recovery Plan. In this phase, more economic activities will be added to the positive list. Meanwhile, Khairy also pointed fingers at countries that are hoarding the vaccines as the reason for the global vaccine inequity. He said that European countries and other countries like the US, the UK, and Canada have an edge in getting the supply they need. He did this in response to criticism of Malaysia’s vaccination rollout that compared the vaccination programme in Malaysia to Hungary.EU Ambassador to Malaysia Michalis Rokas has since denied that the bloc was hoarding vaccines. He said all requests from the Malaysian government regarding the distribution of vaccines have been approved without any problems by the EU Secretariat.Rokas added that all vaccine exports, as per request by Malaysia, were approved within two to three days and also been given due exception because of the pandemic emergency.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Form Five Students To Get Vaccines Starting Next Month, Says KJ
Content: The Education Ministry has requested to vaccinate Form Five and Form Six students.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Form Five students will be getting their Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccines starting next month, according to Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Khairy Jamaluddin.Malay Mail quoted the Minister who said that they are trying to get it done by July as requested by the Ministry of Education. He also added that the vaccines would be administered in schools.Yes, first dose in July. Form Five students, because the Education Minister wants the option. This has not been decided by the National Security Council (NSC), but he wants the option to send the exam students, Form Five and Form Six students back to school, perhaps by the end of July or August, depending on the spread of cases.Recently, the Health Ministry has approved the use of Comirnaty vaccine produced by Pfizer-BioNTech to children aged 12 and above. It was given a conditional registration on 8 January this year, and is used to vaccinate individuals 18 years of age and older. Although these additional indications have been approved, the MOH is of the view that the priority of vaccination is still to high-risk groups in line with the existing policy set under the National Covid-19 Immunization Program (NCIP).The Ministry also agreed to grant conditional registration approval for use during a disaster for two (2) vaccine products produced by CanSino Biologics Inc (China) and Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen Vaccine which has been granted approval by the World Health Organization (WHO) for Emergency Use Listings (EUL).Its reported that both vaccines only require only one dose.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Nationwide Infection Rate Is Down, Vaccines Up But Still A Long Way To Go
Content: KKM forecasts that the transmission rate will go down further to 0.9 if Covid-19 standard operating procedures (SOP) are met.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.Malaysia’s Covid-19 infection rate has gone down, but we’re still in the red.Official figures released by the Health Ministry (KKM) indicate that the R-value (R0/Rt) or the rate of transmissions nationwide as of 17 June was at 0.95, and over the past week, the country has seen a marginal drop in the number of infections.However, the Rt rate in Kuala Lumpur, Sabah, Negeri Sembilan and Labuan remains higher than the national average.Kadar kebolehjangkitan Covid-19 atau Ro/Rt pada jangkaan mengikut kes seharian pada 17 hb Jun 2021 untuk seluruh negara adalah 0.95.. Manakala pecahan mengikut negeri adalah seperti di lampiran. pic.twitter.com/RRW50yqEO9Reportedly, Malaysia’s test positivity rate (TPR) or the number of positive results acquired from testing was at 4.99%.According to the World Health Organization (WHO), a country’s TPR needs to be below 5% for conditions to be considered OK, and based on the government’s Covid-19 Recovery Plan, we would still need to wait for daily cases to drop below 4,000 before the total lockdown order can be lifted.Read More: There Are 4 Phases Planned For The Country To Recover From Covid-19KKM forecasts that the transmission rate will go down further to 0.9 if Covid-19 standard operating procedures (SOP) are met.Currently, 678,764 people have been infected with coronavirus with 66,097 cases remaining active.The country has also lost a total of 4,202 souls due to the deadly plague.The Special Committee on Covid-19 Vaccine Supply Access Guarantee (JKJAV) reports that over 5 million of the country’s denizens have been inoculated – with 11% of the population having already received their 1st dose of the coronavirus vaccine.Read More: Less Than 150,000 Doses Per Day Administered In The Last Two DaysJKJAV Head Khairy Jamaluddin explained that the country is targeting to vaccinate more than 200,000 people every day in July, and over 300,000 people daily starting August.KJ also promised that Malaysians could begin walking in for Covid-19 vaccinations without prior appointments by September this year.Yesterday, the country hit a positive milestone by vaccinating a total of 221,706 people in a single day.Pemberian vaksin COVID-19 pada 17 Jun merekodkan jumlah tertinggi setakat ini. #MenangBersama #LindungDiriLindungSemua pic.twitter.com/Ej8M4wOw2FShare your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: “Ada Yang Hilang Ingatan” – Doktor Ini Perjelas Apa Maksud ‘Long Covid’
Content:
Pendek kata, pesakit Covid-19 yang sudah sembuh namun masih akan menanggung komplikasi Covid-19 yang berpanjangan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Sehingga semalam, Khamis (17 Jun), Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia telah mengeluarkan kenyataan di mana sebanyak 7% pesakit Covid-19 yang dimasukkan ke hospital adalah dari kategori 4 dan 5. Namun, angka ini telah meningkat ke 35% pada awal Mei 2021.BACA JUGA: Ramai Pesakit Covid-19 Kini Berada Dalam Kategori 4 & 5 – Menteri KesihatanAntara faktor-faktor yang menyebabkan peningkatan peratusan pesakit dari kategori 4 dan 5 adalah:Susulan peningkatan pesakit Covid-19 khususnya kategori 4 dan 5, KKM juga telah mengambil inisiatif proaktif kesiapsiagaan Unit Rawatan Rapi (ICU).Perkongsian melalui rangkaian tweets tersebut telah dimuat naik pada 14 Jun dan kini berjaya meraih hampir 6 ribu retweets ketika artikel ini ditulis.Baca penuh di bawah:Doktor, apa ke benda long covid ni?Meh, saya nak cerita.Sebelum tu nak kena faham dulu jangkitan covid ni ada 5 kategori.Kategori 1: positif tapi takde gejalaKategori 2: positif + ada simptoms tapi tak libatkan paru-paru pic.twitter.com/rmrgKEOlYqKategori 3:positif + ada simptoms + ada jangkitan paru-paruKategori 4: positif + ada simptoms + jangkitan paru-paru + perlu bantuan pernafasanKategori 5: positif + ada simptoms + jangkitan paru-paru + perlu bantuan pernafasan + kegagalan organYang kita bimbangMenurutnya, apa yang dibimbangkan adalah kategori 2, 3, 4, dan 5. Bila dah masuk ketegori Ini, kemungkinan besar pesakit akan mengalami komplikasi covid yang dipanggil LONG COVID! Kenapa dipanggil Long Covid? Pendek kata, pesakit Covid-19 yang sudah sembuh namun masih akan menanggung komplikasi Covid-19 yang berpanjangan.Contohnya seperti, batuk tak hilang-hilang, hidung tersumbat, lendir di tekak. Kalau sebelum ini boleh jogging, sekarang jalan pun semput, buah pinggang rosak sampai kena dialisis, sakit-sakit tubuh tak hilang, sakit perut berpanjangan, selalu sakit dada, dan sakit kepala yang teramat.Bukan setakat itu sahaja, paling parah apabila ada yang sampai hilang ingatan, dan ada juga yang mandul. Memang menakutkan!Itulah realitinya. Apa yang kita nampak setiap hari, angka kes positif dan angka kes sembuh. Tapi hakikatnya, berapa ramai yang sembuh tapi menanggung Long Covid. Siksa tau! Sebab itulah kena ambil vaksin. Tujuan ambil vaksin bukan tak nak kena covid. Tetap ada risiko dapat jangkitan covid cuma tak masuk ke Kategori 2,3,4 dan 5. Itulah tujuan sebenar kena ambil vaksin. Long covid ni lebih menakutkan dari kesan sampingan vaksin. Itu kena faham.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: [VIDEO] Fasih Betul Duta Besar Baru Amerika Syarikat Bertutur Bahasa Melayu. Terkejut Netizen!
Content:
Brian D. McFeeters sebelum ini juga pernah ditugaskan di beberapa kedutaan A.S. lain seperti di Jakarta (Indonesia), Baghdad (Iraq), dan juga Seoul (Korea Selatan).Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Pada Selasa lalu (15 Jun), sebuah klip video Brian D. McFeeters, Duta Besar Amerika Syarikat di Malaysia telah mula tular di media sosial. Video tersebut pada mulanya dimuat naik oleh US Embassy Kuala Lumpur melalui akaun Facebook Rasmi mereka.Konteks video tersebut adalah berkaitan dengan bantuan tambahan Covid-19 bagi membantu meringankan beban rakyat Malaysia seperti vaksin, set PPE, pelitup muka, cecair sanitasi serta peralatan komputer.Hari ini dengan sukacitanya saya mengumumkan bantuan tambahan Covid-19 oleh Kedutaan A.S. kepada Malaysia. Awal bulan ini kami menyampaikan bekalan bantuan Covid-19 kepada NADMA iaitu Agensi Pengurusan Bencana Negara termasuk PPE seperti pelitup muka dan cecair sanitasi untuk barisan hadapan, dan peralatan komputer yang akan digunakan oleh NADMA untuk membantu barisan hadapan berkenaan Covid-19 di Malaysia. Ini merupakan bahagian kedua bantuan yang diberikan oleh Kedutaan A.S. pada awal tahun ini berjumlah dua ratus lima puluh ribu dolar.Menurut beliau lagi, Amerika Syarikat juga akan bekerjasama dengan COVAX bagi menyumbangkan 80 juta dos vaksin tambahan untuk program vaksin Covid-19 global yang dikendalikan oleh GAVI dan Pertubuhan Kesihatan Sedunia (WHO).BACA JUGA: Jepun Dijangka Bakal Sumbang Vaksin AZ Kepada MalaysiaNamun, setelah kefasihan Brian berjaya mencuri perhatian rakyat Malaysia, video tersebut kini kian tular dimuat naik oleh warganet di pelbagai platform media sosial.Malahan, ada juga segelintir warganet yang mengatakan bahawa penguasan bahasa beliau adalah lebih baik daripada sesetengah rakyat kelahiran Malaysia.Untuk pengetahuan anda, sebelum beliau berkhidmat sebagai Duta Besar di Kuala Lumpur pada bulan Mac 2021, beliau pernah dihantar bertugas sebagai seorang diplomat di beberapa kedutaan A.S. lain seperti di Jakarta (Indonesia), Baghdad (Iraq), dan juga Seoul (Korea Selatan).Oleh itu, tidak hairanlah apabila beliau petah berbahasa Melayu, Indonesia, Perancis, Sepanyol, dan Jerman.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Japan Wants To Give AZ Vaccines To Malaysia
Content: It’ll be sent out in July, if the situation permits.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.Japan will be giving out AstraZeneca vaccines that are manufactured there to multiple nations in Asean, including Malaysia.Bernama quoted the Japanese Embassy in Malaysia which said that the vaccines will come by July, if the circumstances allow.The country is also looking to provide vaccines to Indonesia, the Philippines and Thailand.Previously, Japan has given out vaccines to other countries such as Taiwan where 1.24 million doses were sent and more recently, Vietnam, where they pledged to donate around 1 million vaccines.The country recently granted conditional approval to single-dose Covid-19 vaccines manufactured by China’s CanSino Biologics and Johnson & Johnson from the United States.It’s reported that we’ll get the Johnson & Johnson shots via the global Covax facility which is backed by the World Health Organisation.As for the CanSino vaccines, reports point out that the government has ordered around 3.5 million doses.According to Health Ministry, around 4.9 million Covid-19 vaccines have been administered so far with 215,876 shots registered on 15 June.In terms of registrations, almost half of the total population or 13.8 million Malaysians have signed up to get the jab.Jumlah pemberian vaksin COVID-19 setakat 15 Jun 2021 ialah 4,904,109 dos. 215,876 dos pada 15 Jun.Jumlah yang terima dos pertama ialah 3,435,420 orang. Daripada jumlah itu, 1,468,689 orang juga terima dos kedua Daftar di MySejahtera, https://t.co/jWUzMEwwWM Tel 1800888828 pic.twitter.com/cIT8WVIJpMShare your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. Article_Title: [TERKINI] 4 Fasa Telah Dirancang Untuk Negara Pulih Dari Covid-19 – PM
Content:
Perdana Menteri, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yasin berkongsi perincian Pelan Pemulihan Nasional.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Perdana Menteri Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin hari ini (15 Jun) mengumumkan Pelan Pemulihan Nasional untuk Malaysia pulih dari pandemik Covid-19.Pelan ini akan dilakukan secara berperingkat dan bergantung kepada tiga faktor iaitu:Malaysia kini berada dalam fasa pertama iaitu ‘total lockdown’. Ini kerana kadar jangkitan adalah masih tinggi, sistem kesihatan beroperasi pada kapasiti maksimum, dan peratusan populasi yang telah divaksinasi masih rendah.Fasa 2 akan dilaksanakan setelah:Pada fasa ini, lebih banyak aktiviti ekonomi akan ditambahkan ke senarai positif dan ianya akan hanya dapat beroperasi pada kapasiti 80%.Sektor sosial masih dilarang dan perjalanan antara negeri tidak dibenarkan.Pada fasa ini, aktiviti sosial akan dibuka secara berperingkat dan senarai negatif akan dilaksanakan.Parlimen dapat bersidang semula apabila Fasa 3 dicapai.Fasa 3 akan dilaksanakan setelah:Semua aktiviti di sektor sosial dan ekonomi akan dibuka sepenuhnya. Ini juga merupakan fasa di mana pelancongan domestik dan perjalanan antarabangsa akan dibenarkan.Fasa 4 akan dilaksanakan setelah:Muhyiddin mengatakan bahawa Rancangan Pemulihan Nasional ini direka dinamik. Maksudnya, semakin cepat kita mencapai objektif, semakin cepat kita akan melepasi fasa-fasa tersebut.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: [DIKEMASKINI] SOP PKP ‘Total Lockdown’ Oleh MKN Berkuat Kuasa 15 Jun 2021
Content:
Mana-mana aktiviti yang tidak dinyatakan dalam SOP ini adalah tidak dibenarkan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Untuk memudahkan anda, perubahan SOP yang telah dibuat oleh pihak kerajaan telah ditanda dengan **Berikutan negara Malaysia kini berada di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan ‘Total Lockdown’ yang berkuat kuasa pada 1 Jun sehingga 14 Jun kini telah dilanjutkan lagi bermula 15 Jun sehingga 28 Jun 2021. Dan seperti biasa, hanya akan ada beberapa sektor perniagaan dan aktiviti sahaja dibenarkan untuk beroperasi.Di bawah merupakan SOP AM Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP) ‘Total Lockdown’ yang telah dikeluarkan oleh pihak Majlis Keselamatan Negara (MKN) dan telah dikemaskini berkuat kuasa 15 Jun 2021.SELURUH NEGARA TERMASUK SABAH, SARAWAK DAN WILAYAH PERSEKUTUAN LABUAN.Mesyuarat perlu diadakan secara sidang video.MANA-MANA AKTIVITI YANG TIDAK DINYATAKAN DALAM SOP INI ADALAH TIDAK DIBENARKAN.Walau bagaimanapun, untuk mengetahui senarai perkhidmatan perlu yang dibenarkan beroperasi sepanjang PKP ‘Total Lockdown’ ini, boleh lihat seperti yang telah dikemas kini oleh pihak MKN di bawah:A. Pembuatan (Kapasiti 60% pekerja) B. Pertanian, Perikanan, Penternakan, Perladangan dan Komoditi (Kapasiti Optima) C. Pembinaan D. Perdagangan Pengedaran E. Lain- Lain Apa-apa perkhidmatan, kerja, industri dan perniagaan sebagaimana yang ditentukan oleh Kerajaan selepas berunding dengan pihak berkuasa yang mengawal selia perkhidmatan, kerja, industri dan perniagaan itu.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: Kids Above 12 To Be Vaccinated, Single-Dose Covid-19 Vaccines Approved In Race For Herd Immunity
Content: We’re in a race against time to achieve herd immunity.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.The government has given its approval to use single-dose Covid-19 vaccines in our race to achieve herd immunity during this pandemic.Health Director General Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah announced that this decision was made at the Drug Control Authority (DCA) meeting held today, in light of the emergency situation faced by the country today.Two single-dose vaccines will be made conditionally available in Malaysia: the CanSino vaccine from China and the Johnson & Johnson vaccine from the Netherlands.Additionally, the Pfizer vaccine will be made available for children above the age of 12. Before this, children under the age of 18 were not recommended to be given the vaccine.These vaccines will be provided on a conditional basis, although priority will still be given to high-risk individuals under the National COVID-19 Immunization Program (PICK).PBKD meluluskan pendaftaran bersyarat utk bagi 2 produk vaksin 1 dos pelalian, iaitu CanSino, China dan Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine keluaran Johnson & Johnson serta vaksin Comirnaty keluaran Pfizer-BioNTech kpd usia 12 tahun dan ke atas.https://t.co/jpoaYWnLRDShare your thoughts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!Anne is an advocate of sustainable living and the circular economy, and has managed to mum-nag the team into using reusable containers to tapau food. She is also a proud parent of 4 cats and 1 rabbit.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Lepas Lebih Setahun, Pelan Pemulihan Nasional Covid-19 Kini Dirangka – PM
Content:
Kita tunggu.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Setelah lebih setahun negara dilanda pandemik Covid-19, kerajaan kini sedang merangka Rancangan Pemulihan Nasional – ianya akan berdasarkan data, sains, dan semua persiapan yang diperlukan.Pelan ‘jalan keluar’ ini telah diumumkan oleh Perdana Menteri Malaysia, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin yang mengatakan bahawa perkara ini dilakukan sebagai persiapan ketika Covid-19 mencapai tahap yang wajar.“Sudah tiba waktunya negara memiliki Rancangan Pemulihan Nasional untuk keluar dari masalah ini, namun ianya merupakan sesuatu yang besar, bergantung kepada kerjasama dan dukungan semua pihak,” katanya selepas mengunjungi Pusat Vaksinasi Bergerak (PPV) di Projek Perumahan Rakyat (PPR) Sri Johor, Bandar Tun Razak, semalam (13 Jun).Seperti Program Vaksinasi Nasional, pelan ini juga akan dilakukan secara berfasa.Setakat ini, beberapa menteri utama yang terlibat dengan rancangan pelan ini telah duduk berbincang bersama Tan Sri Muhyiddin untuk membentangkan draf tersebut.Untuk melaksanakan rancangan ini, Malaysia terlebih dahulu perlu mengawal kes positif Covid-19. Salah satu kaedah yang dipertimbangkan oleh Perdana Menteri adalah dengan memperkenalkan tarikh akhir bagi pendaftaran Program Vaksinasi Covid-19.Sehingga semalam (13 Jun), hanya 56.80% atau 13,789,736 rakyat Malaysia yang layak telah mendaftar untuk mendapatkan vaksin tersebut. Sebanyak 4,490,270 dos vaksin diberikan setakat ini dan hanya 1,357,966 penerima telah menerima dua dos yang lengkap.Semalam merupakan hari ketiga berturut-turut di mana Program Vaksinasi Nasional gagal mencapai sasaran 150,000 vaksinasi setiap hari yang telah ditetapkan untuk bulan Jun.Dan semestinya, pengumuman draf Rancangan Pemulihan Nasional disambut dengan keraguan oleh rakyat Malaysia.Dah setahun baru nak drafting, syabas.Slow dia kalah internet.Covid 19 still battling la our dear Abah… but where is the helping hand to battle for the RAKYAT…. what is happening to the auto moratorium which should help the rakyat to battle this pandemic. how many rakyat could not fight to survive a proper mealLocally, we have to be in unison in our efforts. Right now, not all on same wavelength and with common sense. Globally, there must be less disparity. Right now, new variants emerging threaten entire communities.Pray we can get decent progress soon…Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: MySejahtera Helpdesk Now Addresses Appointment Issues
Content: Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.As much as we depend on the MySejahtera app for almost everything mobility and vaccine related, it is not perfect. Even today, the folks from the app released a statement on Twitter which basically said ‘try uninstalling and installing it back again’ if your app is unresponsive.For some of you, who face unresponsive 'Check-In' page, kindly uninstall and reinstall the MYSJ app. Kindly note that 'Check-In' history in the app will be reset when reinstalled due to security reasons. MOH contact tracing database has a record of all your check-ins.It’s a terrible hassle especially when you’re in a hurry and it crashes on the check-in screen. For those of us who are concerned about our vaccination appointments and check the app every day, The Special Committee for Ensuring Access to COVID-19 Vaccine Supply (JKJAV) today tweeted out that there are some new options in the MySejahtera Helpdesk section.Here are some notable options you should check out:This option is for those who had trouble during the second AstraZeneca vaccination signup. Sadly it is not for us who just want our vaccine appointments now. If you have an elderly parent or loved one and they have not got their appointment, tap this. Whatever you do, make sure they get on that vaccination list. There are a lot of options for useful information here. It answers questions that you may have ranging from ‘hey, why is my vaccination status stuck at assessment’, to ‘when is my appointment’, to ‘can me and my spouse get the same appointment date?’.As expected, most of the options at the help desk would lead you to information instead of a form where you can voice your concerns. Still, information can be very useful and if you are still not satisfied, you can email the JKJAV at info@vaksincovid.gov.my or call them at the JKJAV hotline: 1 800-888-828.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Hanya Dalam Masa 5 Bulan, Covid-19 Telah Meragut 3 Nyawa Kanak-kanak Di Malaysia
Content:
27 orang kanak-kanak kini berada di ICU dan 19 orang daripadanya berumur bawah lima tahun.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram TRPBM untuk updates terkini yang relevan dan menarik!Tiga kematian telah direkodkan dan melibatkan kanak-kanak bawah umur lima tahun dalam masa lima bulan pertama tahun 2021, yang jumlahnya sama dengan jumlah keseluruhan di Malaysia sepanjang tahun 2020, kata Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan, Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah.Setakat ini, KKM melaporkan bahawa 27 orang kanak-kanak telah dimasukkan ke Unit Rawatan Rapi (ICU) Pediatrik pada tahun 2021, dan 19 orang daripadanya berusia bawah lima tahun.Ini merupakan peningkatan berbanding tahun 2020, kerana hanya lapan orang kanak-kanak yang dimasukkan ke ICU tahun lalu dan enam daripadanya berusia bawah lima tahun.BACA SINI: Kes Brought In Dead (BID) Kian Meningkat – Ini 3 Cara Perkara Ini Boleh TerjadiKKM berharap semua pihak, terutamanya ibu bapa dan penjaga dapat memainkan peranan penting dalam melindungi mereka yang mempunyai imuniti rendah seperti bayi dan anak-anak agar dilindungi dari virus Covid-19. Bina persekitaran yang selamat untuk mereka dengan mematuhi sepenuhnya SOP yang ada dan segera dapatkan vaksin jika anda seorang dewasa yang layak.Malaysia telah mencatatkan 103 kematian baru dari koronavirus pada 5 Mei, menjadikan jumlah kematian setakat ini kepada 3,096.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Content:

Article_Title: Teacher Posting Fake Vaccine News Gets Country’s First Fake News Ordinance Charge
Content: The post was said to have been made on 21 April in a police station.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.A 50-year-old tuition teacher, Mohd Nazaruddin Yusoff, is believed to be one of the first person to be charged under the ‘Fake News’ law of the Emergency Ordinance since it was put into effect in March 11.Nazaruddin pleaded not guilty at the Sessions Court in Johor Bahru. He is said to have made a post on Facebook titled “Mati lagi… di Pontian, vaksin kedua” or “Second vaccine, Another death… in Pontian”, reported Free Malaysia Today.The post included a photo of three police officers attending to another police office while a police woman was seen standing beside them.After a post-mortem, it was reported that the policeman died of a heart attackNazaruddin was said to have made the post around 1.50am, on 21 April at the Pontian district police headquarters.The Emergency (Essential Powers) (No. 2) Ordinance 2021 describes  “fake news” as news or information that “is or are wholly or partly false relating to Covid-19 or the proclamation of emergency”.Those who create, publish or distribute fake news will face a fine of up to RM100,000, a jail term of up to three years or both.Nazaruddin was released after posting RM8,000 in bail and is required to be back in court on July 7 for the next mention, reported Malay Mail.The case was handled by Johor State Director of Prosecution, Tengku Amir Zaki Tengku Abdul Rahman, while the accused was not represented by counsel.READ MORE: Authorities Are Cracking Down Hard On Covid-19 SOP Rule Breakers & Fake NewsShare your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: [TERKINI] PM Umum Rancangan Pemerkasa Plus Bernilai RM40 Bilion
Content:
Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Perdana Menteri, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin hari ini telah mengumumkan bahawa di bawah rancangan PEMERKASA Plus, tambahan RM2.1 bilion akan dibelanjakan untuk program Bantuan Prihatin Rakyat (BPR).Bagi isi rumah dengan pendapatan di bawah RM2,500 akan menerima RM500.Bagi isi rumah dengan pendapatan antara RM2,501 hingga RM5,000 akan menerima RM300.Individu bujang akan menerima RM100.Pembayaran akan dibuat mulai akhir bulan Jun. Ini sebagai tambahan kepada fasa terakhir BPR yang akan berakhir pada bulan September.Beliau menambah bahawa mereka yang berada dalam kategori B40 dan mereka yang kehilangan pekerjaan, termasuk perusahaan mikro dan PKS yang tidak dibenarkan beroperasi selama PKP – akan diberi pilihan antara menerima moratorium automatik selama tiga bulan atau pengurangan pembayaran balik pinjaman mereka sebanyak 50% selama 6 bulan.Pemandu teksi dan bas yang layak boleh mendapat moratorium pinjaman mereka sehingga 12 bulan dan melanjutkan pinjaman sehingga 36 bulan.MARA akan meneruskan program Peace of Mind MARA PRIHATIN sehingga 31 Julai 2021.Peminjam boleh membuat permohonan secara dalam talian untuk penjadualan semula pembayaran pinjaman pelajar atau moratorium.Pengusaha MARA yang terjejas oleh penutupan ekonomi akan diberi potongan 30% untuk penyewaan premis perniagaan untuk bulan Mei hingga Julai 2021.Program Subsidi Upah di bawah PERKESO akan diperpanjang selama 1 bulan untuk semua sektor ekonomi yang terjejas dengan had 500 pekerja setiap permohonan.Dijangka 2.5 juta pekerja dan lebih dari 200 ribu majikan akan mendapat keuntungan.Majikan yang berdaftar dengan Pembangunan Sumber Manusia Berhad akan diberi pengecualian pembayaran pungutan selama satu bulan pada bulan Jun 2021.Pekerja juga dapat meningkatkan pengetahuan dan kemahiran melalui portal pembelajaran e-LATiH percuma dengan lebih daripada 400 modul dan kursus kemahiran.Kadar Geran Khas Prihatin (GKP) akan dinaikkan sebanyak RM500 kepada RM1,500.Hampir 1 juta PKS dan perusahaan mikro akan menerima RM1,000 pada pertengahan Jun dan RM500 lagi akan diberikan pada bulan Julai.Bagi peniaga kecil, peniaga tepi jalan, dan termasuk perusahaan mikro – pembiayaan kredit mikro sebagai modal kerja disediakan sepanjang tahun oleh BSN, TEKUN, MARA, SME Corp, dan YAPEIM dengan kadar pembiayaan serendah 3%.Sebanyak RM7 bilion dana pinjaman untuk PKS dengan kadar serendah 3.5% masih ada.Kerajaan juga bersetuju untuk memberikan Bantuan Khas one-off bernilai RM500 kepada 17,000 pemandu pelancong, 40,000 pemandu teksi, 11,000 pemandu bas sekolah, 4,000 pemandu bas persiaran, dan 62,000 pemandu kereta sewa dan pemandu e-hailing. Bayaran ini akan disalurkan kepada penerima yang berdaftar pada bulan Julai.Untuk sektor kesihatan, kerajaan akan memperuntukkan RM450 juta untuk meningkatkan kapasiti katil dan peralatan ICU untuk rawatan Covid-19.Ini untuk semua hospital dibawah Kementerian Kesihatan dan Hospital Pengajar Universiti Awam seperti di UiTM, UPM dan UKM serta hospital medan ATM.Selain itu, penyumberan luar juga akan dilaksanakan di hospital swasta. Jumlah ini merangkumi RM200 juta yang diumumkan oleh Menteri Kewangan pada 22 Mei.RM550 juta diperuntukkan untuk menampung keperluan perbelanjaan yang berkaitan dengan Covid-19 oleh pelbagai agensi termasuk peningkatan kos operasi dan pengurusan dalam menangani krisis kesihatan Covid. Ini termasuk ubat-ubatan, reagen untuk pemeriksaan, dan pelantikan pegawai berdasarkan kontrak.Ini juga merangkumi kos operasi untuk Pusat Kuarantin dan Rawatan Covid-19 atau PKRC di MAEPS dan di peringkat negeri.Tempoh perkhidmatan lebih 14,000 pegawai perubatan dan jururawat yang ada di bawah kontrak dilanjutkan sehingga 2022.Kerajaan juga akan melantik semula lebih daripada 500 pekerja kesihatan yang menghadapi persaraan wajib tahun ini secara kontrak.Di samping itu, kerajaan juga akan melantik semula lebih daripada 500 pekerja kesihatan yang menghadapi persaraan wajib tahun ini secara kontrak.Perdana Menteri mengatakan bahawa pada akhir bulan Jun, kita akan dapat mencapai sasaran 150,000 dos vaksinasi sehari dan mengalu-alukan kerjasama sektor swasta, NGO, dan organisasi masyarakat untuk memperhebatkan usaha ini.Secara keseluruhan, PEMERKASA Plus akan melibatkan dana berjumlah RM40 bilion dan mempunyai tiga matlamat:Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: Over A Million Malaysians Have Received Both Covid-19 Vaccine Doses
Content: 1,771, 810 people have received the first dose taking vaccine recipients in the country to 2,786,152.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Adham Baba said in a tweet yesterday (29 May) that 1,014,342 people in Malaysia has completed both Covid-19 vaccine doses.Jumlah pemberian vaksin COVID-19 setakat 28 Mei 2021 ialah 2,786,152 dos. (+73,776 pada 28 Mei)Jumlah yang terima dos pertama ialah 1,771,810 orang. Daripada jumlah itu, 1,014,342 orang telah terima dos kedua.Daftar di MySejahtera, https://t.co/jWUzMEwwWM Tel 1800888828 pic.twitter.com/xMJOL1AJEeThe state with the highest number of recipients who have completed the two doses is Selangor with 138,063 people, followed by Sarawak (96,450), Kuala Lumpur (94,397), and Johor (88,240).As of Friday (29 May) 48,60% or 11,788,915 individuals have registered to receive vaccine shots, with Selangor continuing to record the highest number of registrations at 3,159,392. But, it only accounts for 65.22% of the population of Selangor that is eligible for the vaccination.Putrajaya recorded the highest compliance with 66,337 (100%) registrations.The National COVID-19 Immunisation Programme, has three phases. The first involved frontliners and healthcare workers and was conducted between February and April this year.The second phase, which starred in April involves 9.4 million senior citizens, at-risk individuals, and person with disabilities and is expected to end in August.The third phase has already begun and is expected to end in February 2022. This phase involves those above 18 years old.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: You May Get Fined If You Don’t Show Up For Your Covid-19 Vaccine
Content: Reports of 52,000 individuals across seven states have missed their appointments to date.Subscribe to our new Telegram channel for the latest updates and stories.Malaysia may start issuing fines to those who fail to show up for their Covid-19 vaccination appointments.In an online press conference held today (27 May), Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr. Adham Baba said his ministry is in discussion with the National Security Council (NSC) after it was reported that more than 52,000 individuals across seven states have missed their appointments– with Kedah registering 20,000 of those missed appointments.Due to the vaccine rollout having to be done in stages with a delivery schedule, Dr. Adham said:That’s why we feel applying penalties and mandatory vaccination must be implemented once all voluntary avenues like online registration, by MySejahtera or doing face-to-face appointments fail.Dr Adham also went on to say he is worried about the new variants that are emerging in the increasingly high number of positive cases. The variants first detected in Nigeria, the United Kingdom, South Africa and India are already in the community.Dr Adham goes on to say that the public must realise this vaccine is free and its rollout is being done in stages.Other matters mentioned in relation to vaccines include:In the efforts to help have a smoother and faster vaccine rollout process, Dr. Adham has also asked for non-governmental organisations to help with outreach once these vaccines have arrived.In other vaccine related news, as at Wednesday 26 May, Putrajaya is the first territory to have 100% of their residents registered for vaccinations while Sabah is on the other end of the spectrum with only 17.76%.For more vaccination progress statistics, visit The National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (JKJAV) website.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Decoding What Went Wrong During Yesterday’s (Wednesday 26 May) Astrazeneca’s Vaccine Registration
Content: Unsuccessful registrations were due to technical glitches reported but what went wrong?Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Social Media was buzzing Wednesday (26 May) when the latest round of #CucukMYAZ registrations began but was delayed due to technical errors.Laman tempahan janji temu vaksin AstraZeneca masih sedang dikemas kini. Anda boleh mula membuat tempahan slot bermula 12.15 tengah hari. Segala kesulitan amat dikesali.Many were experiencing problems such as the “Register Now” button appearing and disappearing. Some applicants later received notifications telling them they had been blocked from the registration site www.vaksincovid.gov.myWhen the site could finally be accessed around 12:20 pm, Razif Mohamed, an Interactive Media Specialist at a private University in the Klang Valley, was quick to share a screencap on his Facebook of the browser’s error console revealing issues on the site.TRP spoke to Razif, who said the obvious issue for sure is the traffic load. He states the server couldn’t handle it but ultimately, it was also the user experience.When users would select the button to choose the state they are in, there was no visual response. You are supposed to see the dates to pick from so people end up clicking many times and that will send more request to the server which burdens the traffic load even more.Although the website showed Razif that there were plenty of slots available, almost all the slots were actually taken. Needless to say, the user experience frustrated him.Why could some people see the green (available) slots while others couldn’t?After doing a right-click and inspect on the browser, Razif saw error messages in the console where the return value suggested that it might be due to a fully booked slot – but we won’t know for sure. His guess is because of server congestion and the data that was needed to display or update the slots was not returned.They should have anticipated the traffic. After the first round, people are now more convinced after seeing friends have gotten it.The website on the surface may look good, what goes on underneath not many people see…. until you right-click on the browser and inspect the page that is.Razif goes on to note that no average desktop user is going to monitor the status bar loading as they are more likely focused on the button at hand.While the server may be fast as browsing the site was no issue, it may have been because there was no response from the API server.API acts as a tunnel for the data server to communicate and serve data to what is being requested by the webserver/website. From an end-user’s perspective they see a button, click on it and they can see nothing happen.What they don’t see is the code that shows an error in communicating with the API server. A few things can lead to this error such as a congested data/API server and therefore made it fail to respond.After trying to load on several different browsers on his desktop, while his wife tried via mobile, neither could obtain a slot.Sharp-eyed netizens noticed that the government website, which had a budget of RM70 million to build, was using a free version of Cloudflare, which could have possibly led to limitations.I just waddled through some of the #CucukMYAZ website and stumbled into this. The API to get the list of PPVs is RATE LIMITED. CAN YOU NOT USE THE FREE VERSION OF CLOUDFLARE YOU NUMBNUTS! pic.twitter.com/JuR8xShKOaHowever, others claim that the reason why the website experience was so bad was due to the high volume of traffic, not the free plan limitations.Error 1025 is rate limiting because of plan limitations. Error 1200 is rate limiting because there are still too many requests pending from the origin server. In this case it’s because the origin server is too overloaded, not because of plan limitations.While we could endlessly scrutinise what went on behind the site, there are two main issues to highlight here in terms of the website’s functionality.Or TLDR;1) Failure to accommodate high traffic;2) Poor user experience.Let’s hope it’s all fixed by the time the next wave of registrations come along.Share your thoughts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: CONFIRMED: AZ Phase 2 Vaccines Will Open For ALL Tomorrow
Content: KJ said those on the waiting list from Phase 1 will automatically be included as well.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.At today’s press conference, Science, Technology, and Innovation Minister, Khairy Jamaluddin confirmed that Phase 2 of the AstraZeneca vaccine opt-in program will be open to all ages starting tomorrow, 26 May 2021.Registrations will be open beginning at 12 noon, on the Covid-19 vaccination website HERE.To register for the AZ vaccine, you must register on both your MySejahtera app and online at the Covid-19 vaccination website.READ MORE: If You Can’t Get Your Vaccine Appointment, Your MySejahtera App May Have A BugWe have given a few days for the elderly, so we have decided that for AstraZeneca phase 2 in Klang Valley, Pulau Pinang, Johor, and Sarawak, registration will be open to all under the age of 60 starting 12 noon Wednesday, 26 May 2021, which is tomorrow.As of now, there are 1.26 million doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine set aside for Phase 2, however, only 228,347 slots have been taken up so far.Registrations for Phase 2 of the AstraZeneca vaccine were first only opened to the elderly above 60 years old. However, only 18% of the doses have been claimed.As such, the remaining Phase 2 vaccines will be open to ALL, including those under the age of 60. However, the vaccines will only be available in Kuala Lumpur, Selangor, Penang, Johor, and Sarawak.During the question and answer session Khairy said that in light of the new recommendations, lactating mothers who were previously rejected from getting the AstraZeneca vaccine will be reallocated.They will be contacted by Special Committee on Ensuring Access To Covid-19 Vaccine Supply (JKJAV) or they can contact the JKJAV directly.The new recommendations by JKJAV released on the 24th, changed the recommendation status of AstraZeneca for lactating mothers from “Available data on its safety is limited. Recommendation will be made after consultation” to “Suitable to be vaccinated.”Also yesterday, 24th May 2021, the highest number of vaccine doses were provided to Malaysians at 95,000 doses given.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Anne is an advocate of sustainable living and the circular economy, and has managed to mum-nag the team into using reusable containers to tapau food. She is also a proud parent of 4 cats and 1 rabbit.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: SOP AM Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP 3.0) Dikemas Kini Oleh MKN
Content:
SOP AM yang telah diperketatkan ini bakal berkuat kuasa pada 25 Mei 2021.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Umum sedia maklum di mana kes positif harian di Malaysia kini dilaporkan hampir mencapai 7,000 kes. Oleh itu, pihak kerajaan telah memutuskan untuk meletakkan seluruh negara di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan 3.0 bermula 10 Mei yang lalu dan juga telah mengetatkan lagi SOP AM dan bakal berkuat kuasa pada 25 Mei 2021, Selasa.“Malaysia sedang berhadapan dengan gelombang ketiga COVID-19 yang boleh mencetuskan suatu krisis nasional,” kata Perdana Menteri, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin dalam satu kenyataan.Di bawah merupakan SOP AM Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan 3.0 yang telah diperketatkan serta dikemas kini oleh pihak MKN.NOTA: Kawasan yang terlibat adalah seluruh negara termasuk Wilayah Persekutuan Labuan. Langkah-langkah khusus yang sedang dilaksanakan di Sabah dan Sarawak diteruskan.a)  Bilik hotel atau penginapan berbayar bersendirian dan melibatkan ahli isi rumah.b)  Ruang kerja bersendirian.c)  Aktiviti sukan dan rekreasi outdoor.d)  Kenderaan sendiri dan melibatkan ahli isi rumah.e)  Kawasan dan tempat awam indoor atau outdoor tanpa ada individu lain.f)  Sewaktu makan dan minum di tempat awam tanpa ada individu lain (selain di restoran atau premis makanan).Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: #CucukMYAZ 2 Reminder: AstraZeneca Vaccine Open For Registration This Sunday
Content: Phase 2 Registrations can be made online on 23 May and is only open for seniors 60 years old and above.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Mark your calendars and remind your family and friends who are 60 years and above that registration for the second phase of the AstraZeneca opt-in vaccination begins at 1200hrs on Sunday 23 May.The second round of AstraZeneca opt-in will open at 1200hrs on Sunday, 23 May at https://t.co/TF4fINjmn7. This will only be open to residents of Klang Valley, Penang, Johor, Kuching and Miri who are above the age of 60.Things to note:*While vaccine slots lastThis is a follow-up to the announcement made on 17 May with a reported 1.1 million AZ vaccine doses to be made available.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Former advertising mad woman - turned mother to an amazing little girl born 3 months early - and now a returned writer. Also a textbook ambivert with no clue about today's pop music but a walking encyclopedia of music from the 80s and 90s.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: #CucukMYAZ 2: Next Round Of AstraZeneca Vaccine Only Open For Elderly
Content: 1.1 million AZ vaccines will be made available for volunteers.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.The government announced that it will again be taking volunteers to be administered with the AstraZeneca (AZ) Covid-19 vaccine.The program, however, would only be available for senior citizens aged 60 and up in Kuala Lumpur, Selangor, Penang, Johor and Sarawak.Reportedly, 1.1 million AZ vaccine doses will be made available this time around.Registrations will be opened online from 23 to 26 May on the official National Immunization Program (PICK) website or manually with local community clinic outreach programs.Volunteers could also register for an AZ vaccine appoinment via the MySejahtera mobile application.Vaccine Minister Khairy Jamaluddin said that the AZ vaccine will additionally be sent and administered to those in elderly care homes and facilities.He explained that priority for the 2nd round of AZ vaccine shots is given to the elderly to keep them safe and protected as well as to quicken Phase 2 of the National Immunization Program (PICK).However, those on the present round 1 waitlist will get appointments.KJ also gave assurance that 25,000 people who were put on the waiting list during the 1st AZ vaccine registrations will be included in the 2nd round.The government had on, 2 May, offered Klang Valley citizens a chance to register and volunteer to receive the AZ vaccine between the months of May and June in order to boost the country’s vaccination rate and improve public perception of the AZ vaccine.Netizens also took to social media with the hashtag #CucukMYAZ to share their experiences of being vaccinated at one of three special vaccination centres (PPV) located at the Putra World Trade Center (PWTC), University Malaya (UM) and Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM).Find out how the trend started on TRP.READ MORE: Creator of #CucukMYAZ Shares How They Came Up With The NameShare your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Typing out trending topics and walking the fine line between deep and dumb.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Ini Situasi Covid-19 Di Malaysia Lepas Rakyat Beraya Selama 4 Hari Pada Hujung Minggu Lepas
Content:
Kematian harian mencapai tahap tertinggi dengan jumlah 44 kematian pada Hari Raya ketiga.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Secara keseluruhan terdapat 16,888 kes Covid-19 baru, 14,959 kes pulih baru dan 141 kematian disebabkan oleh Covid-19 di Malaysia pada hari perayaan Aidilfitri hujung minggu lalu.Jumlah kes tertinggi dicatatkan pada hari pertama Raya dengan 4,855 kes – diikuti dengan jumlah kes pulih tertinggi pada hari kedua Raya dengan 4,190 kes, dan jumlah kematian tertinggi tercatat, 44, pada Hari Raya ketiga.Status Terkini #COVID19, 15 Mei 2021 Kes sembuh= 3,432Jumlah kes sembuh= 422,329Kes baharu positif= 4,140 (4,131 tempatan, 9 import) Jumlah positif= 466,330Kes kematian= 44Jumlah kes kematian= 1,866Kes dirawat di ICU= 503Bantuan Alat Pernafasan= 272 pic.twitter.com/e2Bs29JZfQTan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah, Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan dalam satu Tweet menyatakan bahawa baru-baru ini terdapat lebih banyak kes kematian di luar hospital di Lembah Klang.Menurutnya, semasa mayat dibawa ke hospital, ujian Covid-19 diberikan dan bedah siasat akan dilakukan.Malah, beliau turut menambah bahawa sehingga kini, Unit Rawatan Rapi (ICU) untuk merawat pesakit Covid-19 di hospital kerajaan juga telah kehabisan ruang.Menurut Dr Noor Hisham, 80% kapasiti ICU di hospital di Kuala Lumpur, Selangor, Pulau Pinang, Sarawak, Kedah, dan Perak sedang digunakan untuk merawat pesakit Covid-19 dan beberapa hospital kini tidak boleh menampung pesakit baru.Hari ini telah dilaporkan bahawa kontena khas telah disediakan oleh Jabatan Forensik Hospital Sungai Buloh sebagai tempat simpanan mayat tambahan untuk mereka yang meninggal dunia disebabkan oleh Covid-19.Dalam kenyataan itu, Kementerian Kesihatan juga menyatakan bahawa lebih dari 80% kematian berkaitan Covid-19 di negara ini adalah melibatkan warga emas yang menghidap satu atau lebih penyakit kronik atau komorbiditi. Mereka menambah bahawa penyebab kebanyakan jangkitan adalah daripada ahli keluarga terdekat.Ini adalah salah satu sebab betapa pentingnya penjagaan SOP, terutama bagi mereka yang hidup dengan individu yang berisiko tinggi, dan betapa pentingnya vaksin kepada orang tua.Jabatan Perubatan Forensik @HOSPITALSGBULOH terpaksa menyediakan kontena khas sebagai tambahan tempat penyimpanan jenazah/mayat yang meninggal dunia kerana #COVID19. Hari ini, enam lagi kematian dilaporkan di hospital itu. Lebih 80% kematian COVID-19 pic.twitter.com/Eul26FwkypKini, Malaysia berada dalam fasa kedua program Imunisasi Covid-19 Nasionalnya yang memfokuskan pada orang tua, mereka yang menghidap penyakit kronik, dan orang kurang upaya (OKU).Pada pada yang sama, pendaftaran terbuka untuk vaksin kini telah disediakan bagi mereka yang berada di Lembah Klang, serta kawasan zon merah yang lain seperti Johor, Pulau Pinang dan Sarawak.BACA SINI: Pusingan Kedua Vaksin AstraZeneca Akan Mula Dibuka Buat Warga Emas Pada 23 Mei 2021 – KJKongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: How Malaysia Faced Covid Over The 4-Day Raya Weekend
Content: Daily deaths reached all-time high with 44 on third day of Raya.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.In total there were 16,888 new Covid-19 cases, 14,959 new recovered cases and 141 deaths caused by Covid-19 in Malaysia over the 4-day Raya weekend.The highest number of cases was recorded on the first day of Raya with 4,855 cases, followed by the highest number of recovered cases on the second day of Raya with 4,190 cases, and the highest number of deaths on record, 44, on the third day of Raya.Status Terkini #COVID19, 15 Mei 2021 Kes sembuh= 3,432Jumlah kes sembuh= 422,329Kes baharu positif= 4,140 (4,131 tempatan, 9 import) Jumlah positif= 466,330Kes kematian= 44Jumlah kes kematian= 1,866Kes dirawat di ICU= 503Bantuan Alat Pernafasan= 272 pic.twitter.com/e2Bs29JZfQTan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah, Health Director General at the Health Ministry in a Tweet stated that recently there have been more cases of deaths outside of hospitals in the Klang Valley.When the bodies are brought to the hospital, a Covid-19 test is given and a post-mortem is performed.At the same time, intensive care units (ICU) to treat Covid-19 patients at government hospitals are running out of space.According to the Health DG, 80% of the ICUs in hospitals in Kuala Lumpur, Selangor, Penang, Sarawak, Kedah, and Perak are currently being used to treat patients with Covid-19 and some hospitals are already at full capacity.Today, it has been reported that special containers were provided by the Forensic Department of Sungai Buloh Hospital as additional storage for the bodies of those who died because of Covid-19.In the statement, the Health Ministry also said that over 80% of the Covid-19-related deaths in the country are of senior citizens with one or more chronic illness or comorbidity. They added that the cause of most of the infections is close family members.These events highlight the importance of following the SOP, especially for those who are living with those of high risk, and how critical it is for the elderly to get the vaccine.di negara ini golongan berusia dan menghidap lebih satu penyakit kronik atau komorbiditi. Kebanyakan mereka mendapat jangkitan daripada ahli keluarga terdekat. Jika anda tinggal bersama golongan berisiko tinggi, lindungi diri anda untuk anda melindungi mereka.Currently, Malaysia is in the second phase of its National Covid-19 Immunisation program which focuses on the elderly, those with chronic diseases, and the differently-abled (OKU).At the same time, an open registry for the vaccine has been made available for those in the Klang Valley, where the pandemic has hit the hardest, and soon to other areas as well.Share your thoughts with us via TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: SOP Am Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP 3.0) Oleh MKN [DIKEMASKINI 11 MEI 2021]
Content:
Seluruh Malaysia kini berada di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP) selama dua minggu bermula 12 Mei 2021 (mulai 12.01 pagi) sehingga 7 Jun 2021 (11.59 malam).Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Untuk memudahkan anda, perubahan SOP terbaru yang telah dibuat oleh pihak kerajaan telah ditanda dengan **.Umum sedia maklum, kerajaan telah memutuskan untuk meletakkan seluruh Malaysia di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP) selama dua minggu bermula 12 Mei 2021 (mulai 12.01 pagi) sehingga 7 Jun 2021 (11.59 malam)Bagi memudahkan anda, kami menyediakan ringkasan yang mudah difahami untuk SOP AM Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP 3.0) seperti di bawah:SELURUH NEGARA*Langkah-langkah khusus yang sedang dilaksanakan di Sabah, Sarawak dan Wilayah Persekutuan Labuan diteruskan.Kesimpulannya, apa-apa aktiviti yang boleh menyebabkan ramai orang hadir di suatu tempat sehingga menyukarkan penjarakan fizikal dan pematuhan kepada arahan Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan dan lain-lain perkara yang diputuskan oleh Kerajaan dari semasa ke semasa adalah tidak dibenarkan.Senarai SOP di atas telah dikemaskini pada 11 Mei 2021.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: [TERKINI] Seluruh Malaysia Kini Berada Di Bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan – PM
Content:
Jumlah kes harian kini telah melebihi 4,000 kes dan 37,396 kes aktif dengan 1,700 kes kematian dilaporkan.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Seluruh Malaysia kini berada di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP) kerana jumlah kes Covid-19 negara terus meningkat.Perdana Menteri, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin dalam satu kenyataan menunjukkan bahawa jumlah kes harian kini telah melebihi 4,000 kes dan 37,396 kes aktif dengan 1,700 kes kematian dilaporkan setakat 10 Mei 2021.“Malaysia sedang berhadapan dengan gelombang ketiga COVID-19 yang boleh mencetuskan suatu krisis nasional,” kata Muhyiddin dalam kenyataan itu.Malah, beliau turut mengatakan bahawa kewujudan varian-varian baharu dengan kadar jangkitan yang lebih tinggi, kekangan ke atas kapasiti sistem kesihatan awam yang semakin meruncing dan kelemahan pematuhan SOP dalam kalangan sebahagian anggota masyarakat menuntut Kerajaan untuk mengambil tindakan yang lebih drastik bagi mengelakkan negara terjerumus ke dalam malapetaka kesihatan yang lebih parah.“Data dan sains terus menunjukkan bahawa aktiviti-aktiviti perhimpunan yang menyukarkan penjarakan sosial dan keberadaan orang ramai dalam ruang yang sesak menjadi punca utama penularan COVID-19.“Rantaian jangkitan COVID-19 hanya dapat diputuskan dengan menggalakkan orang ramai duduk di rumah menerusi kawalan pergerakan yang lebih ketat,” tambahnya.Sehubungan itu, Sidang Khas Majlis Keselamatan Negara Mengenai Pengurusan COVID-19 yang dipengerusinya hari ini telah membuat keputusan untuk melaksanakan Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan di SELURUH NEGARA seperti berikut:IKUTI BERITA SELANJUTNYAKongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: SOP Am Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP 3.0) Oleh MKN [DIKEMASKINI 7 MEI 2021]
Content:
Perlu diingatkan juga bahawa setiap daerah/negeri mempunyai SOP-SOP tertentu yang telah dikeluarkan oleh pihak kerajaan contohnya bagi WP Kuala Lumpur, Selangor, Johor, dan Pulau Pinang.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Untuk memudahkan anda, perubahan SOP terbaru yang telah dibuat oleh pihak kerajaan telah ditanda dengan **.Umum sedia maklum, kerajaan telah memutuskan untuk meletakkan beberapa negeri dan daerah di bawah Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP) selama dua minggu mengikut tarikh bermula hingga berakhir iaitu 14 hari untuk setiap negeri/daerah.Namun begitu, setiap daerah mempunyai SOP-SOP tertentu yang telah dikeluarkan oleh pihak kerajaan. Sila rujuk senarai di bawah:Bagi memudahkan anda, kami menyediakan ringkasan yang mudah difahami untuk SOP AM Perintah Kawalan Pergerakan (PKP 3.0) seperti di bawah:Apa-apa aktiviti yang boleh menyebabkan ramai orang hadir di suatu tempat sehingga menyukarkan penjarakan fizikal dan pematuhan kepada arahan Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan serta lain-lain perkara yang diputuskan oleh Kerajaan dari semasa ke semasa.Walau bagaimanapun, keputusan untuk meneruskan ataupun menutup operasi Bazar Ramadaan, Bazar Aidilfitri dan pasar malam adalah tertakluk di bawah kuasa Kerajaan Negeri melalui Pihak Berkuasa Tempatan (PBT).• **Aktiviti sukan dan rekreasi adalah tertakluk kepada SOP Am Sektor PKP Sukan dan Rekreasi oleh Kementerian Belia dan Sukan.Aktiviti-aktiviti berikut TIDAK DIBENARKAN beroperasi dalam tempoh PKP:Senarai SOP di atas telah dikemaskini pada Khamis, 7 Mei 2021.Kongsikan cerita menarik dan terkini bersama kami di media sosial TRP: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. Article_Title: To Highlight Malaysian Workers’ Struggles, Activists Hold “Carry the Weight” Silent Protest For Labour Day
Content: The protest also took place in multiple locations across the country.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.As Labour Day came and went on 1st May, celebrating workers around the world, the plight of Malaysian workers became the highlight at the “Carry the Weight” silent protest at Jalan Tuanku Abdul Rahman, Kuala Lumpur.A protester stood on the sidewalk of the busy shopping area with a pair of weights, balanced on a stick on their backs (like food vendors in olden days). The weights were filled with items symbolising the various economic burdens borne by workers.Onlookers were invited to ‘Carry the weight’ to relieve the burden of the protester.The event was organised by almost 100 organisations including Persatuan Pengguna Islam Malaysia (PPIM), Parti Sosialis Malaysia (PSM), Aliran Kesedaran Negara (ALIRAN), All Women’s Action Society and Misi Solidariti.They said the protest was to show Malaysians and the government the financial burdens faced by the workers of Malaysia, especially of the working class in factories, domestic workers, estate workers, and e-hailing and delivery riders/drivers who are “the victims of a corrupt system, poor fiscal planning and the collapsing economy due to the Covid-19 Pandemic.”The government does not seem to care about the fate of the workers and this action is symbolic of the burdens we bear with our diminishing salaries and buying power in this crippled economy, as the government wastes away our money without parliamentary scrutiny and refuses to meet or dialogue with us on our struggles.As such the protest is a call to the government to take the necessary actions, based on the demands of the workers in the May Day Declaration 2021.The 1 May 2021 declaration puts forth 15 demands for the welfare of Malaysian workers, which are:Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.She puts the pun in Punjabi. With a background in healthcare, lifestyle writing and memes, this lady's articles walk a fine line between pun-dai and pun-ishing.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: KJ Says Pahang CITF Issued Vaccines To Genting Workers, Acting Without His Knowledge
Content:
The Minister says he wrote to the Pahang State Government on 12 April regarding the matter.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.After rumors circulated on social media that some workers of Genting Group have been vaccinated ahead of the elderly and high-risk individuals, the Federal Minister in charge of rolling out vaccines has laid the blame squarely at the feet of state officers.Science, Technology and Innovation Minister Khairy Jamaluddin said in a statement that he had never issued such a directive the decision to do so was made by the Covid-19 Immunisation Task Force (CITF) in Pahang.Following the rollout of phase 1 vaccinations for frontliners, Khairy said some states had thought they could roll out the vaccine to other recipients.Jawapan kepada tuduhan saya mengarahkan pekerja Genting divaksin. https://t.co/QrOcDwWitN https://t.co/OnRvv8EGVe pic.twitter.com/eNHhcOA3Dq“In Pahang, the State CITF had decided to give the vaccine to workers in the tourism sector involving 56 hotels in Kuantan, Genting Highlands, Camerong Highlands, Jerantut, Raub, Mentakab, Bentong, Bukit Tinggi and Fraser Hill.“The decision to administer these vaccines were made when the Pahang state had given finished first doses of vaccines (while waiting for time to pass before giving the second) to all recipients listed in the priority phase 1 group,” said Khairy.He continued that the Federal CITF only found out about the decision by the state’s CITF after they had started giving out the vaccines.Khairy says he has since written to the Pahang State Government on 12 April 2021 that only the Special Committee for Ensuring Access to COVID-19 Vaccine Supply (JKJAV) has purview over who belongs on the list of early vaccinations.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.TRP's Head of Editorial, Hamzah was formerly a hard-news journalist who reported on politics, did investigative work, and occasionally went undercover. 
He now spends his days sitting at a desk, checking grammar and fielding calls from PR companies, which is totally fine and fulfilling. For sure. 
He's also married with kids now so his wife and mother said he can't do risky things anymore.© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: There’s A Vaccination Centre In Sunway Now & Here’s How To Register If You’re Living In Petaling
Content: The Sunway Pyramid Convention Centre is expected to vaccinate around 1.8 million people living in Petaling.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.You can now get vaccinated at the Sunway Pyramid Convention Centre (SPCC) until February 2022 – a period of ten months – under the National Covid-19 Immunisation Programme (NCIP).Touted as Malaysia’s first large-scale centre, it has a capacity to vaccinate around 5,000 people per day and it’s expected that the SPCC will vaccinate around 1.8 million people in the Petaling district. The 150,000 sq ft hall has been used for the first phase of the vaccine programme during which some 9,000 frontliners have been vaccinated and 13,000 doses have been administered to date.As for the inoculation process, this will be carried out by Petaling Health District Office.Sunway said that so far, they have committed more than RM50 million since March 2020 and are providing their convention centre rent-free for 11 months to support the national immunisation programme, which will cost Sunway another RM28 million.To register for the vaccination, there are a few ways that you can do so:Wait for the appointment date and details via MySejahtera. Ensure that the app push notification is activated for you to receive details on the appointment.Share your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Covid-19 Cases Have Increased By 45% In This Week Alone, Says MOH
Content: Cases have been increasing for the past three weeks, the Ministry noted.Subscribe to our Telegram channel for the latest stories and updates.Covid-19 infections in Malaysia have risen sharply over the past three weeks with an increase of about 45% in this week alone says Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Adham Baba.According to reports from Berita Harian, he said that this week, week 15 of 2021, a total of 13,745 new cases were recorded compared to 9,507 cases in week 14.This means, he said, the average daily cases have now increased to 1,963 cases, or by 45% and the average for active cases has also increased by 18% to 17,096.Dr Adham was said the rise in infections has been detected over the past three weeks, starting in the 12th week of this year.It’s reported that the second phase of the National Covid-19 Immunization Program, which prioritises the elderly, the disabled and the chronically ill, has started today.Science, Technology and Innovation Ministry Khairy Jamaluddin said appointment notices for vaccine injections were sent starting April 5, two weeks before the appointment date, through the MySejahtera application, phone calls and short messaging system (SMS).Fasa kedua vaksinasi akan bermula hari ini.Untuk mengakhiri pandemik ini, JKJAV menggalakkan lebih ramai golongan rentan untuk mendaftar untuk vaksinasi bagi fasa keduaDaftar untuk vaksinasi: https://t.co/m1joWOB4OE#LindungDiriLindungSemua pic.twitter.com/s4CtyQURZnShare your thoughts with us on TRP’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Unkempt in both stories and appearance, Hakim loves tech but tech left him on read, previously he used to write about tall buildings and unoccupied spaces that he can't afford, and legend has it that he still can't afford it to this day© 2021 The Rakyat Post. All Rights Reserved. Owned by 3rd Wave Media Sdn Bhd

Article_Title: Kes Covid-19 Cecah 2,000 Hari Ini. KKM Mohon Larangan Rentas Negeri Ditangguh
Content:
Menteri Kesihatan menjelaskan bahawa peningkatan jumlah kes Covid-19 ini tidak menunjukkan tanda-tanda stabil.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Malaysia mungkin akan memasuki gelombang keempat jangkitan Covid-19 kerana hari ini, pihak Kementerian Kesihatan Malaysia (KKM) melaporkan jumlah kes baru melonjak melebihi 2,000 dan ia merupakan yang tertinggi dalam masa 41 hari.Dari 2,148 kes baru yang dilaporkan hari ini (15 April), Sarawak telah mendahului dengan 512 kes, diikuti oleh Selangor (459) dan Kelantan (221).Negeri lain dengan kes tiga digit hari ini adalah: Sabah (202), Johor (182), Kuala Lumpur (171) dan Pulau Pinang (134).Pecahan kes mengikut negeri, 15 April 2021. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/ncModh3843Kali terakhir kes baru Malaysia mencapai tahap ini adalah pada 5 Mac 2021 dengan 2,154 kes telah dilaporkan.Menurut laporan The Vibes, Kementerian Kesihatan meminta kerajaan supaya menangguhkan kebenaran merentas negeri sempena Hari Raya Aidilfitri yang bakal menjelang tiba pada bulan Mei nanti.Menteri Kesihatan, Datuk Seri Dr Adham Baba menjelaskan bahawa ini disebabkan oleh peningkatan jumlah kes Covid-19 yang tidak menunjukkan tanda-tanda stabil.Kebimbangan juga meningkat setelah wujudnya varian baru coronavirus yang muncul dalam beberapa komuniti, terutamanya varian Afrika Selatan B.1.351.Semalam (14 April), Ketua Pengarah Kesihatan, Tan Sri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah mengumumkan bahawa sudah ada 17 kes varian Afrika Selatan di Malaysia.Varian khusus ini bukan sahaja lebih mudah ditularkan tetapi suntikan vaksin kurang berkesan terhadapnya. Ia juga boleh memberi kesan kepada Program Imunisasi Nasional Covid-19.Kongsi pendapat anda bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.

Article_Title: “Aktiviti Yang Benarkan ‘Mask’ Dibuka Punca Kes COVID-19 Meningkat” – Pakar Kesihatan
Content:
Menurut Dr Malina, kerajaan perlu kaji semula tentang kebenaran untuk membenarkan rakyat makan di luar.Jangan lupa follow channel Telegram kami untuk berita dan cerita terkini yang baru dan menarik!Pakar Kesihatan Awam Fakulti Perubatan dan Sains Kesihatan UPM, Profesor Madya Dr Malina Osman menjelaskan bahawa keadaan akan lebih terkawal apabila mengunjungi bazar, pasar raya atau sebarang aktiviti lain yang tidak memerlukan mereka untuk membuka pelitup muka (mask).Menurut laporan yang dipetik oleh Astro Awani, beliau mengatakan setiap kali kerajaan memberikan kelonggaran daripada segi untuk makan di luar atau boleh melakukan majlis keramaian, kita akan lihat kes meningkat.Pada pandangan saya ia sangat berkaitan dengan kebenaran membenarkan membuka pelitup muka, demikian juga yang kita saksikan selepas Pilihan Raya Sabah yang mana bila keadaan sedemikian dibenarkan, banyak kes-kes baharu yang dicatatkan.Beliau turut menyuarakan pendapatnya agar dalam tempoh dua hingga tiga minggu atau sebulan yang akan datang, perkara ini dikaji semula tentang kebenaran untuk membenarkan masyarakat makan di luar bagi membendung peningkatan yang tinggi berlaku.Untuk aktiviti ekonomi pada pandangan saya tidak ada masalah, kalau kita patuh kepada SOP, pakai pelitup muka, jaga jarak, tidak ada isu.Tambah lagi, Dr Malina mencadangkan pihak kerajaan untuk memperhebatkan usaha vaksinasi dalam kalangan mereka dan pihak kerajaan juga boleh memulakan suntikan vaksinasi kepada mereka yang dikesan negatif semasa ujian pengesanan COVID-19.Ujarnya, cara itu adalah untuk memastikan lebih ramai yang disuntik vaksin dalam tempoh masa yang lebih cepat. Dengan itu, ia sekali gus dapat mencapai imuniti kelompok secepat yang mungkin.Kongsi pendapat anda bersama kami di media sosial TRPBM: Facebook, Twitter dan Instagram.I enjoy writing and eating at the same time. I sit at my work desk for hours every day. Oh! I like cafe hopping, though I don't drink coffee. I'm, uh.. indecisive. I see eight sides of everything.
